title: ogami_tamaki
body:
One of the characters of “[[idolmaster million live!|THE IDOLM@STER MILLION LIVE!]]”.

She has [[orange eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] in [[one side up|right side up]].

Profile:
* Attribute: Dance (Million Live!) /  Angel ([[IDOLMASTER MILLION LIVE! Theater Days|Theater Days]]) / Flame and Rainbow ([[IDOLMASTER PopLinks|PopLinks]])
* Age: 12
* Height: 147cm
* Weight: 39kg
* BWH: 76.0cm-51.0cm-77.0cm
* Birthday: April 29 (Taurus)
* Blood type: B
* Handedness: Right
* Hobbies: Exploration
* Special skill: Stone throwing (Million Live!) / [[Stone skipping]] (Theater Days)
* Likes: Athletic Land
* Hometown: [[kagawa_prefecture|Kagawa]] (previously lived outside Japan).
* Current address: [[Tokyo (city)|]]
* Voice actress: [[Inagawa Eri]] (稲川 英里)

The wild child of the MILLION STARS, Tamaki seems to come from a rural place, as she is incredibly fond of nature and she often swims in the river and captures lizards and insects. There's also no other kids her age where she lives, so she became an idol because she heard that doing so would help her make many friends.

It wouldn't be too far-fetched to call Tamaki the most child-like child among the younger idols -- she is innocent, energetic, and full of curiosity. Tamaki likes to play outdoors, watch sentai shows, and be the leader of a Sentai squad. She also loves all kind animals (including frogs and insects), which is why she gets along especially well with [[Kousaka Umi]] and [[Ganaha Hibiki]].

Tamaki feels embarrassed to be seen in a dress, but also shows interest to becoming more girly. She also seems to be becoming aware that her feelings for the [[Producer (idolmaster)|]] might be something more than just an innocent feelings of friendship. However, for the most part, she's still just a child.

h4. Appearance
h5. Million Live!
* !post #1757423: [[Casual|Casual outfit]]
* !post #1757424: [i] [[Million Dreams (idolmaster)|]] [/i]
* !post #1665208: [i] Melon Pop Green [/i]
* !post #1757210: [i] [[Prologue Rouge (idolmaster)|]] [/i]
* !post #1637915: This kitten is [[Kobun (idolmaster)|]], a kitten that would later be kept in the theater.

h6. [[idolmaster million live! theater days|Theater Days]]
* !post #8734769: [i] [[Elementary Schoolmate (idolmaster)|]] [/i]

title: deathtrooper
body:
A fictional soldier type from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction series.

It appears in the [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]] Anthology film from 2016.

The [b]Deathtrooper[/b] is a type of specialized and elite [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] [[Stormtrooper]] clad in black armor and a modified helmet.

Not be confused with the novel of the same name.

title: summer_pockets
body:
Summer Pockets is a Japanese visual novel video game developed by [[Key (company)|]], a brand of VisualArt's. It was released on June 29, 2018 for Windows and is rated for all ages.

Summer Pockets is Key's 13th game.

h4. Staff
[[Na-Ga]] is the chief artist and character designer, and additional character designs are provided by [[Izumi Tsubasu]] and [[Nagayama Yuunon]]. [[Chibi]] characters are designed by [[engiyoshi]].

h4. Characters

* [[Naruse Shiroha]]
* [[Sorakado Ao]]
* [[Takahara Hairi]]
* [[Kamiyama Shiki]]
* [[Katou Umi]]

h4. See also
* [[Summer Pockets school uniform]]

h4.External links
* "Game official website (jpn)":https://key.visualarts.gr.jp/summer/
* "Anime official website (jpn)":https://summerpockets-anime.jp/
* "Anime official X (jpn)":https://x.com/samapoke_anime
* "Wikipedia (eng): Summer Pockets":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summer_Pockets
* "Wikipedia (jpn)":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summer_Pockets
* "VNDB: The Visual Novel Database":https://vndb.org/v20424

body:
A [[school uniform]] worn by the high school students living on an island where [[Summer Pockets]] takes place.
It's a [[white serafuku]] with a [[white sailor collar]] decorated with a [[black ascot]]. Its [[white shirt|shirt]] has [[puffy short sleeves]] and girls wear a [[miniskirt]] with [[white ribbon|white ribbons]].
A variant for boys is unknown.

h4. Example
* !post #9115836

h4.See also
* [[List of uniforms]]

title: toad_(animal)
body:
An amphibious four-legged [[animal]]. 
[b]Not to be confused with[/b] [[frog]]. Unlike frogs, the physical differences of toads are rough, dry skin, warts on body, stockier body, crests under eyes and mostly come in dull colouring. Toads prefer to crawl and jump on shorter distance compared to frogs. 
Toads are found on every continent, excluding [[Antarctica]]. They prefer to inhabit humid, moist areas like [[wetland]]s, [[pond]]s, or [[lake]]s. Both frogs and toads do croaking vocalization, lay eggs, grow up from [[tadpole]]s, and feed on small animals which are mainly [[bug]]s. Toad tadpoles look chunkier than frog ones.

For the character in the Mario series, see [[Toad (Mario)]].

title: kobeni's_car_(chainsaw_man)
body:
The car bought by [[Higashiyama Kobeni]]. Kobeni bought it with her own money to chauffeur her family.

Kobeni's car is modeled after the [[Fiat 500]] and is small, with a roundish roof, small wheels, a boxy front, a rectangular window shield, two doors and an older fashioned steering wheel. Kobeni's car is seen painted a bright yellow, leaning more towards pastel than vibrant.

The car is semi-jokingly popular with the Japanese fanbase due to its checkered career, scoring higher than Kobeni herself on a popularity poll.

title: plastic_bag
body: A [[bag]] that is made out of plastic. It can be colored and opaque so you can't see what's inside, or clear and see-through so you can see its contents. Seen with [[shopping bag|shopping bags]] and [[gift bag|gift bags]].

body:

For small bags designed to give gifts, see [[gift bag]]. To avoid confusion, an example with both a gift bag and a sack clearly present is post #374610.

title: snakey_showgirl_(idolmaster)
body:
[b]Snakey Showgirl[/b] is a [[LUXURY (idolmaster)|]] costume that first appeared in the [[idolmaster 2|THE iDOLM@STER 2]]. It has made subsequent appearances in the following 2nd Vision games.

h4. Snakey Showgirl NEO

The costumes appeared in [[Idolmaster Million Live!|THE iDOLM@STER MILLION LIVE!]].
It was a costume that changed the colours and patterns of [[Million Dreams (idolmaster)|]] to a Snakey Show Girls look.
The following three idols wore this costume. Snakey Showgirl NEO is also the name of an idol unit made up of these three members.

* !post #1757410: [[Ganaha Hibiki]]

* !post #1757660: [[Nikaido Chizuru]]

title: savannah
body:
A savanna or savannah is a mixed woodland-grassland ecosystem characterized by the trees being sufficiently widely spaced so that the canopy does not close. It is characterized by coarse [[grass|grasses]] and scattered tree growth, especially on the margins of the tropics where the rainfall is seasonal, as in eastern [[Africa]].

h4. See also

* [[Grasslands]]
* [[Plain]]

title: holding
body:
Someone is holding an object.

This tag should only be used for items you can pick up and carry with your hands. Don't use for holding body parts (like [[holding hands]], or [[breast hold|holding someone's breasts]]), or for holding clothing being worn (like a [[skirt hold]]), or for holding things with something other than the hands (like a [[mouth hold]], [[holding with feet]], or [[holding with tail]]).

To search for something specific being held, just use two tags together, like this: {{holding popsicle}}. Note that these searches don't always work well. Many posts of a search like {{holding hat}} are people [i]wearing hats[/i] while [i]holding other things[/i], so it would be ineffective to see people [i]holding hats[/i]. Hence the existence of specialized tags.

h4. List of holding tags

title: buller_(magical_girl)_(shingeki_no_bahamut)
body:

A small, bipedal, light green Pokémon with a [[blue rose]] on its left arm and a [[red rose]] on its right. Has three [[thorns]] atop its head and [[black eyes]] with long [[eyelashes]].

Evolves from [[Budew]], and into [[Roserade]].

Not to be confused with [[Roselia_(Bang_Dream!)|Roselia]], the band group from [[Bang_Dream!|BanG Dream!]]

title: shionji_yuuko
body:
One of the main characters in [[Kami-sama no Memo-chou]]. Voiced by [[Ogura Yui]].

She calls herself "Alice", which is a mixed reading of the kanji for Yuuko. She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] in a [[hime cut]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit varies according to her preferences: her indoor wear is composed of a [[bear print]] [[two-tone shirt|two-color]] [[blue shirt|blue]] and [[white shirt]] plus [[white thighhighs]], while her outdoor wear is a [[gothic lolita]] [[black dress]]. 

She is the "brain" of the NEET Detective Team and gathers information to solve the cases with her laptop without stepping out of her bedroom.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5330089: Indoors
* !post #1188724: Outdoors

title: rosalina_(aurora)
body:
An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Rosalina]] in [[Mario Kart Tour]] and [[Mario Kart World]].

She wears a [[long dress|long]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[purple dress|purple]] to [[blue dress|blue]] [[gradient dress|gradient]] [[halter dress]], with a [[white collar|white]] [[collared dress|collar]] and a [[starry sky print]] at the top. Along with it, she wears a small array of [[gem hair ornament|gem hair ornaments]], [[gradient gloves|gradient]] [[blue gloves|blue]] [[elbow gloves]], a [[white pantyhose]] and a pair of [[white shoes|white]] [[pumps]]. Often depicted with an [[aurora]].

title: truck_scale
body:
A truck scale (US) or weighbridge (UK)  is a large [[weighing scale|weighing device]] used for determining the mass of complete commercial vehicles such as trucks, buses, and trailers.  By weighing the vehicle both empty and when loaded, the load carried by the vehicle can be calculated.

title: rosamia_badam
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] [[science fiction]] and mecha series. 

She appears in the [[Zeta Gundam]] series from 1985.

A very beautiful, very disturbed [[Titans (gundam)|]] Newtype female mecha pilot with long blue hair. Her mecha of choice are the [[Gaplant]], the [[Baund Doc]] and the [[Psycho Gundam Mk II]]. [spoiler]Dies during a [[space]] [[battle]] against [[Kamille Bidan]] in his [[Zeta Gundam (mobile suit)|]].[/spoiler]

title: puru_two
body: Supporting character in [[Gundam ZZ]], she is the [[Neo Zeon]] [[clone]] and/or twin sister of [[Elpeo Puru]]. Voiced by the late [[Honda Chieko]]. Piloted the [[Psycho Gundam Mk II]], her own custom [[Qubeley]] Mk-II (in red), and finally the very powerful [[Quin Mantha]].

title: gundam_zz
body:
[b][i]Gundam ZZ[/i][/b] is the 1986 sequel to [i][[Zeta Gundam]][/i]. It was created by a mostly new creative staff, with series creator [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]] being the main returning member. The first half of [i]Gundam ZZ[/i] is infamous for being significantly more comedy-oriented than previous and subsequent [[Gundam]] series. However, the tone of the series changes and becomes more serious in the second half, concluding the story of Zeta.

ZZ is set in the year [b]Universal Century 0088[/b], beginning almost immediately after the end of [i]Zeta Gundam[/i] (and the final battle of The Gryps War). It follows the story of [[Judau Ashta]], [[pilot]] of the [[AEUG]] [[ZZ Gundam|MSZ-010 ZZ (Double Zeta) Gundam]], during [b]The First [[Neo Zeon]] War[/b], a conflict originated due to [[Haman Karn]]'s declaration of war on the now weakened [[Earth Federation]].

Gundam ZZ is notable because it is the first Gundam series where an underage group of pilots ([i]The [[Gundam Team]][/i]) operate more than two different types of Gundams. This trope would be used years later in other very popular Gundam series like [[Gundam Wing]] in the mid 90s and [[Gundam 00]] the next decade.

The story of ZZ continues in [[Char's Counterattack]].

title: gundam_the_battle_master
body:
[b]Gundam: The Battle Master[/b] ([i]Gandamu Za Batorumasutā[/i]) -Later known as [b]Gundam Battle Assault[/b]- is a fighting [[video game]] set in the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse that was released on the [[PlayStation]] console in 1997 only in [[Japan]]. 

GTBM was published by [[Bandai]] and developed by [[Natsume (company)|]]. It is notable because it is considered the first game in the [[Gundam Battle Assault]] series. Despite the game never being released overseas, its opening narration is spoken entirely in English.

h4. Notable mecha

* [[Psycho Gundam Mk III]]

body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]MRX-010 Psycho Gundam Mk. II[/b]

A further evolution of the [[Psycho Gundam]] [[mobile suit|MS]], the sinister-looking [b]Mk. II[/b] was enhanced with also the capacity to transform and a different, purplish finish. It was piloted by [[Rosamia Badam]] ([[Titans (gundam)|]]) and later [[Puru Two]] ([[Neo Zeon]]).

title: sayuri_(doa)
body: A character from [[Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation]]. She successfully trained as a nurse, and had a knack for making her patients feel comfortable. However, it is implied that she did her job too well, which caused her to be let go as her patients didn't want to leave. Eventually, she sought out the Venus Islands hoping to secure a job as its resident nurse, although she ended up getting a lot more than she bargained for when she was recruited for the local Venus Festival after nursing the islands' tenant from a bad case of heat stroke due to her ship running late on arrival.

title: tape_measure
body:
A long and thin strip of plastic or metal, etched with scales. The plastic tape measure is usually short (around 150 cm, although really long ones can reach hundreds of meters) and used by a tailor to take body measurements for clothes-making. The metal ones are usually longer (up to 5 meters and housed in a small dispenser to avoid cutting the hand of its user) and used by carpenters and builders. The dressmaking-related ones are commonly used in the act of [[bust measuring]].

h4. Types

* [[Cased tape measure]]
* [[Open reel tape measure]]

h4. See also

* [[Ruler]]
* [[Stadiometer]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tape measure":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tape_measure]

title: dongtan_dress
body:
A [[tight clothes|tight]], muted color (typically [[grey dress|grey]] or [[black dress|black]]) [[pencil dress]] with low neckline to show [[cleavage]], usually accompanied with an open, [[cropped jacket]] of the same color. The [[long sleeves]] may alternatively be part of the dress. A [[meme attire|fashion meme]] originating from South Korea.

In South Korea, it is often joked on the Internet that the new town area of Dongtan (동탄) in Hwaseong, Gyeonggi has an unusually high number of rich, young married women wearing such dresses, spending time at shopping malls or cafes while their husbands are at work. Dongtan New Town is statistically one of the youngest in the country in terms of average age of residents, with one district scoring as low as 33.5 in September 2023. The township has been perceived as where a number of young married couples wishing to keep the capital area in close reach reside, where most infrastructures of South Korea are concentrated at an extreme density.

The meme has gained traction in 2023 and the name Dongtan has since been used on any young woman dressed in any revealing clothes, practically replacing any sexually suggestive keyword in Korea, with characters such as [[Dongtan Lady (k pring)|]] popping up.

h4. Examples
* !post #6724776: Default
* !post #7627481: [[Sleeveless dress|Sleeveless]] version

title: jiraiya_gouketsu_monogatari
body:
(じらいやごうけつものがたり, "The Tale of the Gallant Jiraiya")

A long-running, unfinished 19th century "kusazoushi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kusaz%C5%8Dshi] novel series written by Mizugaki Egao and his inheritor authors. Illustrated by seven [[ukiyo-e]] artists, including "Utagawa Kunisada":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kunisada].

"Kawatake Mokuami":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawatake_Mokuami] wrote a kabuki drama based on the first ten parts of the novel.

Although the toad-riding thief Jiraiya first appeared in Kan'wa-tei Onitake's Jiraiya Monogatari, Mizugaki's Gouketsu Monogatari is regarded as a great popularizer of Jiraiya's name. His archnemesis, Orochimaru, and his wife, Tsunade, originated from this series.

h4.Characters

* Jiraiya, aka. [[Ogata Shuuma Hiroyuki]]
* [[Tsunade (jiraiya gouketsu monogatari)|]], aka. Ogata Tsunade
* [[Orochimaru (jiraiya gouketsu monogatari)|]]
* [[NARUTO (series)|]] - Some characters' names and "one of the episode titles":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Naruto:_Shippuden_episodes_%28season_6%29#ep133] originated from the novel.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia (JP): 児雷也豪傑譚":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%85%90%E9%9B%B7%E4%B9%9F%E8%B1%AA%E5%82%91%E8%AD%9A

title: grace_(sound_voltex)
body:
Grace is one of the villains of the [[SOUND VOLTEX]] series of rhythm games. Like her archnemesis [[Rasis]], she has pink hair, though tied into [[twintails]], and matching [[pink eyes]]. Additionally, she has two pairs of triple vertical stripes going down the sides of her body. Her outfit consists of a [[collar]], [[strapless bra]], [[panties]], and [[thighhighs]], all colored black with hot pink trim.

title: pneumococcus_(hataraku_saibou)
body:
A recurring type of bacteria in the [[Hataraku Saibou]] series and its spinoffs. It is the personification of the [i]Streptococcus pneumoniae[/i] bacteria.

It is a lanky, skeletal humanoid with razor-sharp claws and tendrils coming out of its head and shoulders that also end in razors. Its body is purple as a reference to the bacteria being "Gram-positive":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gram-positive_bacteria].


h4. External links

* "Official website's character profile":[https://hataraku-saibou.com/1st/character/?chara=s_pneumoniae]
* "Wikipedia article: Streptococcus pneumoniae":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Streptococcus_pneumoniae]
other_names: 肺炎球菌(はたらく細胞)

title: staphylococcus_aureus_(hataraku_saibou)
body:
The personification of the [i]Staphylococcus aureus[/i] bacteria in the [[Hataraku Saibou]] series and its spinoffs.

It is similar to [[Pneumococcus (hataraku saibou)|]] in base appearance; lanky with sharp claws. Though Staphylococcus is more feminine with a golden color and a [[hoop skirt]] made of grape-like nodules, traits that reference the appearance of the real life bacteria.

h4. External links

* "Official website's character profile":[https://hataraku-saibou.com/1st/character/?chara=s_aureus]
* "Wikipedia article: Staphylococcus aureus":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Staphylococcus_aureus]
other_names: 黄色ブドウ球菌(はたらく細胞)

title: total_war:_shogun_2
body: Installment of the [[Total War]] series focused on warring periods in Japanese history. The main campaign is set during the [[Sengoku Jidai]] circa 1450-1600, while DLC adds campaigns for the creation of the [[Shogun]]ate circa 1100s, and for the [[Boshin War]] at the end of the 1860s.

title: claude_clawmark
body:
A [[Nijisanji EN]] [[virtual YouTuber]], part of the ninth wave [[TTT (nijisanji)|]] and designed by [[Araya_(hachino_araya)|]]. 

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with a [[purple hair|purple]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], and [[green eyes]] also with a [[purple eyes|purple gradient]]. His default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless]] [[black shirt]], [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white pants]], [[white boots|white]] [[high heel boots]], and matching purple [[claws]] and beak-themed [[mouth mask]].

title: tame_mene
body:
The song protagonist in [[Abnormality Dancin' Girl (vocaloid)|]], a song by Guchiry.

She has a abnormal obsession with the idea of being "abnormal."

She's a teenage girl with [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[purple eyes]] that become bumpy whenever she has a meltdown, and she has [[crossed bangs]] that form into an X. 

In her 1st outfit, she wears a [[school uniform]] which is a [[collared_shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] covered in a [[purple sweater]] with [[long sleeves]] [[sleeves_past_wrists|that can go past her wrists]], and a [[black necktie]]. She wears a short [[black skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[white shoes]].

In her 2nd outfit, she wears an [[off shoulder|off-shoulder]] [[turtleneck]] [[black dress]]; over the dress is a [[grey shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]]. She wears [[black gloves]] and [[black socks|black]] [[ankle socks]]. She also wears a purple [[hairclip]].

In her 3rd outfit, she no longer has eyebrows and her bangs are no longer crossed. She now has [[short twintails]] with a [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], her ahoge now resembles a butterfly's [[antenna hair|antennae]]. Her eyes are noticably [[crazy eyes|crazier]] and [[constricted pupils|constricted]] and wears a [[smile]]. Her outfit consists of a [[black choker]], a [[necklace]] with three purple circles with black centres with a proboscis in the middle. She wears a two-piece [[black bikini]] that shows her [[underboob]], a [[translucent]] [[black skirt]] that resembles the bottom of a butterfly's wings. She also wears [[translucent]] cloth on her arms which is connected in the middle of her bikini top. She wears torn [[black gloves]] and [[black shoes]] that resemble wings. Her legs go from purple from the bottom and gradually disappear into her skin and finally, she wears six black [[hairclip]]s that resemble eyes onto her twintails.

title: arena_breakout
body:
[b]Arena Breakout[/b] is a free to play FPS Extraction Shooter developed by More Fun studios. Originally released in 2023 for Android and iOS, it would later have a PC version titled [b]Arena Breakout: Infinite[/b] in 2024.

Set in the fictional island nation of Kamona, the country was once a rich and popular tourist destination until a Civil War devastated the nation. With Kamona in ruins, the country is now ruled by criminals, warlords and Private Military Companies who battle each other for their own reasons or gain the many secrets of the island. The player takes control as one of the many mercenary [[military operator]]s who have come to Kamona to gain riches by working with the various factions while also gaining new guns and equipment.

H4. Characters 
* [[Evita (Arena Breakout)|]]
* [[Hecate (arena breakout)|]]
other_names: アリーナブレイクアウト

title: hataraku_saibou
body:
A 2014 manga by [[shimizu akane (artist)|Shimizu Akane]] featuring [[personification|personifications]] of various human body cells. Also known as [i]Cells at Work![/i] in English.

Was adapted into an anime by David Production in 2018, and was later distributed online for free for educational purposes.

h4. Spinoffs

title: common_cell_(hataraku_saibou)
body:
Characters representing generic cells in the [[Hataraku Saibou]] series and its spinoffs.

They are often identical young males with [[black hair]] and [[black eyes]] wearing jeans, sneakers, and a [[white shirt]] that says "細胞" (Cell). They live in [[apartment]] complexes throughout the body where the [[red blood cell (hataraku saibou)|]]s deliver the majority of oxygen and nutrients.

h4. External links

* "Official website profile":[https://hataraku-saibou.com/character/08/]

title: cancer_cell_(hataraku_saibou)
body: Personification of cancer cells in the [[Hataraku Saibou]] series. They resemble [[common cell (hataraku saibou)|]]s but with various misshapen features such as [[veins]], [[heterochromia]], [[white hair]] instead of the normal [[black hair|black]], and [[extra arms]] or even [[wings]].
other_names: がん細胞(はたらく細胞)

title: red_blood_cell_(hataraku_saibou)
body:
Personification of [[red blood cell]]s in the [[Hataraku Saibou]] series. These characters are depicted as the body's couriers, transporting oxygen and carbon throughout the body (as well as nutrients, unlike actual red blood cells).

Their uniform will often consist of a reversible [[red jacket]] and [[newsboy cap]], as well as a pair of blue [[pants]] ([[shorts]] for females).

Younger versions of these characters are known as [[Erythroblast (hataraku saibou)|]]s.

h4. Tagged characters
h5. Original series
* [[AE-3803]]: Female protagonist, often paired with [[U-1146]]
* [[AA-5100]]: Female senior co-worker of AE-3803 with long brown hair.
* [[NT-4201]]: Female junior co-worker and partner of AE-3803 with medium black hair.
* [[PO-1076]]: Minor character
h5. [[Hataraku Saibou BLACK]]
See post #4881987 for reference.
* [[AA-2153]]: Male protagonist
* [[AC-1677]]: Friend of protagonist
* [[AD-6614]]: Bald senior
* [[AG-2357]]: Purple-haired senior
* [[BB-5123]]: Friend of BD-7599
* [[BD-7599]]: Senior with sideburns
* [[JJ-4141]]: Elderly senior
* [[NC-8429]]: Black-haired junior with blush stickers.

title: nt-4201
body: A [[red blood cell (hataraku saibou)|]] from [[Hataraku Saibou]]. She is the junior of the main character [[AE-3803]]. She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[black hair]] and [[black eyes]]. She is more serious compared to her clumsy senior.

title: po-1076
body: A [[red blood cell (hataraku saibou)|]] from [[Hataraku Saibou]]. He is a minor character who was seen carrying nutrients with other red blood cells to a housing complex filled with [[cancer cell (hataraku saibou)|]]s. He has grey-[[brown hair]].

title: ag-2357
body:
A [[red blood cell (hataraku saibou)|]] from the [[Hataraku Saibou BLACK]] spinoff series. He is a senior to the main character [[AA-2153]] to whom he acts harshly due to having a cynical nature from working in an unhealthy body. He has [[purple hair]] and [[black eyes]].

The name "AG-2357" seems to be unconfirmed and some sources simply call him "Purple-haired red blood cell".

title: ad-6614
body:
A [[red blood cell (hataraku saibou)|]] from the [[Hataraku Saibou BLACK]] spinoff series. He is a [[bald]], elderly red blood cell who coaches the main character [[AA-2153]] during the beginning of the series.

He maintains a cheery appearance but is actually emotionally dead inside due to working in an unhealthy body.

title: nc-8429
body: A [[red blood cell (hataraku saibou)|]] from the [[Hataraku Saibou BLACK]] spinoff series. He is the junior to the main character [[AA-2153]]. He has [[black hair]] and [[blush stickers]].

title: jj-4141
body: A [[red blood cell (hataraku saibou)|]] from the [[Hataraku Saibou BLACK]] spinoff series. He is an elderly red blood cell with [[grey hair]].

title: bd-7599
body: A [[red blood cell (hataraku saibou)|]] from the [[Hataraku Saibou BLACK]] spinoff series. He is the senior to the main character [[AA-2153]]. He has [[black hair]] (closer to [[grey hair|grey]] in the anime adaption) with [[sideburns]].

title: bb-5123
body: A [[red blood cell (hataraku saibou)|]] from the [[Hataraku Saibou BLACK]] spinoff series. He has [[brown hair]] and a [[goatee]] mustache. He seems to be an acquaintance of [[BD-7599]] as they are both frequently seen talking together.

title: ac-1677
body: A [[red blood cell (hataraku saibou)|]] in the [[Hataraku Saibou BLACK]] spinoff series. He is a friend of the main character [[AA-2153]] and is usually seen accompanying him. He has [[blonde hair]] and eyes that are normally [[closed eyes|closed]].

title: aa-2153
body:
The main protagonist of [[Hataraku Saibou BLACK|Cells at Work: Code Black]]. He is a [[red blood cell (hataraku saibou)|]]. Like his female counterpart [[AE-3803]] from the original [[Hataraku Saibou]] series, he also has an [[ahoge]] on the right side of his hair, but his hair is brown instead of red.

He is friends with [[AC-1677]] and frequently runs into [[white blood cell (hataraku saibou)|]] [[U-1196]].

title: postpet
body:
A Japan-exclusive e-mail service developed and hosted by [[Sony]], originally released in 1997 for Macintosh computers. It visualized e-mail as literal mail that was delivered to the user's virtual house, where one of several pets also lived. These pets would leave the house to deliver mail to other users.

* !post #9258873: The Postpet UI, featuring [[Momo (postpet)|]]

h4. Characters

* [[Postman (postpet)|]]

title: jeanne_d'arc_alter_(avenger)_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[Jeanne d'Arc Alter (Avenger) (fate)|]] in her Third Ascension outfit. It looks similar to [[jeanne d'arc (third ascension) (fate)|Jeanne d'Arc (Ruler)]]'s [[jeanne d'arc (third ascension) (fate)|Third Ascension]], but is colored black and has a different design for the torso. This is also the only Ascension form where Jeanne Alter has long hair.

There is a modified version of this outfit that Jeanne Alter wears as a party dress during the Shinjuku story event. It also shows up during the Meihousou Most Foul event, and in [[Fate/Grand Carnival]]. It was released in [[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]] under the name [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter (Violette Vengeur) (fate)|Violette Vengeur]].

The dress that Jeanne Alter wears in the [[jeanne d'arc alter (holy night supper) (fate)|Holy Night Supper]] [[Craft Essence (fate)|]] is also remarkably similar to this Ascension outfit, but there are differences.

title: gundam_gp-03_dendrobium
body:
A fictional manned gargantuan mobile weapon from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam 0083]].

[b]RX-78GP-03 Dendrobium[/b]

The last of the machines produced under the Gundam Development Project in full armament. It is comprised of [[gundam_gp-03_stamen|Gundam GP-03 Stamen]] linked to [[dendrobium_schema|Orchis]] unit with Stamen serving as Orchis' core.

Tag only when Stamen is attached to Orchis.

title: saren_(new_year)_(princess_connect!)
body: [[Saren (princess connect!)|]]'s [[official alternate costume|official]] [[new year]] costume in [[Princess Connect!]].

title: gundam_gp-03_stamen
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam 0083]].

[b]RX-78GP-03S Dendrobium Stamen[/b]

The last of the machines produced under the Gundam Development Project, the Stamen [[mobile suit]] resembled the early [[Gundam GP-01 Zephyranthes]] but had a slightly asymmetrical head, thrusters and verniers all over its back and sub-arms stored inside the forearms for ease of use as its real purpose - acting as the core unit for the gigantic armament platform known as the [[dendrobium_schema|Orchis]], together forming [[gundam_gp-03_dendrobium|Gundam GP-03 Dendrobium]].

title: kimi_to_idol_precure
body:
The twenty-second installment of the [[Precure]] franchise, released in 2025. Both [i]Kimi to Idol[/i] and its subtitle [i]You and Idol[/i] both mean the same thing, so the Japanese portion is used here.

h4.Synopsis

I'm Sakura Uta, a second year student who loves to sing!

One day, while walking my dog, Kyu-chan, I was taken by surprise! A big peach-like thing came floating down the river, where I met the cute talking fairy, Purirun!
Purirun has come to search for the Legendary Protectors "Idol Pretty Cure"! Purirun's hometown, KirakiLand was a peaceful place full of sparkles, but it has been plunged into total darkness by Darkine, the boss of the Chokkiri Gang.
So together with Purirun, I decided to search for the Idol Pretty Cure who can illuminate the darkness with light! Maybe it should be the type of person who's bright and happy!
But then the Chokkiri Gang appears in Hanamichi Town, and steals the sparkles of the townspeople... it's a huge pinch!

"I want to make it sparkle! With my song!"

The moment I made that decision, the Pretty Cure Ribbon and Idol Heart Brooch appeared, and I transformed into the Legendary Protector, Cure Idol!

Singing, dancing, and fan service♡
I'm going to make it sparkle no matter what!
The stage between you and me is about to begin!


h4.Characters

* [[Sakura Uta (precure)|]] / [[Cure Idol]]
* [[Aokaze Nana]] / [[Cure Wink]]
* [[Shigure Kokoro]] / [[Cure Kyunkyun]]
* [[Meroron (precure)|]] / [[Cure Kiss]]
* [[Purirun (precure)|]] / [[Cure Zukyuun]]

h4. Fairies

* [[Picarine (precure)|]]

h4. See also

* [[Hanamichi Middle School uniform]]
* [[List of Pretty Cure characters]]

h4. External links

title: eyes_of_grima
body:
Distinctive pattern of six stylized eyes associated with the [[Grima (dragon) (fire emblem)|Fell Dragon Grima]] from [[Fire Emblem]]. This pattern is sometimes found on clothing and tattoos worn by characters associated with the Theocracy of Plegia in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

As the 'eyes' are often split into two groups of three on either sides of a character's clothing (with only one side being visible), the presence of two to three such eyes should generally suffice to tag eyes_of_grima.

Avoid tagging this if the eyes are barely visible (i.e. not enough to visually discern a pattern), even if the character is implied to be wearing them. Also avoid tagging this for [[Grima (Dragon) (Fire Emblem)|Grima]]'s actual eyes while in dragon (or some fan-depicted humanoid) form.

h4. Notable characters
* [[Henry_(Fire Emblem)|]] ([[Fire Emblem]])
** Eyes of Grima along inner 'collar' surface of cloak.
* [[Validar_(Fire Emblem)|]] ([[Fire Emblem]])
** Carries a grimoire with the Eyes of Grima embossed on front cover.
* [spoiler] [[Robin_(Fire Emblem)|]][/spoiler] ([[Fire Emblem]])
** Eyes of Grima along [spoiler]left and right sleeves of coat.[/spoiler]
** Brand of Grima [spoiler]'tattooed' on right hand[/spoiler],
*  [[Grima (dragon) (Fire Emblem)|Grima]] ([[Fire Emblem]])
** [spoiler]Eyes of Grima along left and right sleeves of coat, while in human form.[/spoiler]
** [spoiler]Brand of Grima [spoiler]'tattooed' on right hand, while in human form.[/spoiler]
** Sometimes depicted with Eyes of Grima facial tattoos, while in human form.

title: grima_(dragon)_(fire_emblem)
body:
The Fell Dragon who wants to bring ruin to the world. From [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

English Name: [b]Grima[/b]

[spoiler]
The true main antagonist who came from the same lost future as [[lucina (fire emblem)|Lucina]]. In that timeline, they were able take full control of [[Robin (fire emblem)|Robin]].
[/spoiler]

title: ultraman_tarou
body:
The titular Ultra of [[Ultraman Tarou (series)|]]. His [spoiler]former[/spoiler] human host is [[Higashi Koutarou]].

He's also the son of both [[Mother of Ultra]] and [[Father of Ultra]], despite resembling his cousin, [[Ultraseven]].

He also has a powered up form known as [b]Super Ultraman Tarou[/b], which he achieves by merging with [[Ultraman]], [[Zoffy (ultra series)|]], Ultraseven, [[Ultraman Jack]], and [[Ultraman Ace]], the first instance of 'Ultra Overlapping' (fusion) in the series, turning him into a Super Ultra. He looks visually the same, with the exception of his body glowing with glitter at times.

h4. Appearance

* !post #503188

h4. See also

* [[Ultra Badge]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ultraman Taro":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultraman_Taro_(character)

title: team_dim_sun
body:
The villainous organization in [i][[pokemon ranger: shadows of almia|Pokémon Ranger 2]][/i], led by Blake Hall of Altru Incorporated. Prominent members include the Sinis Trio, consisting of [[Ice (Pokemon)|Ice]], [[Lavana (Pokemon)|Lavana]] and [[Heath (pokemon ranger)|]]; they are still superseded by [spoiler]Kincaid, who masquerades as a teacher in the Pokémon Ranger Academy[/spoiler].

The goal of Team Dim Sun is to awaken Darkrai and submerge all of Almia in unending darkness.

Known as [b]Yamiyami-dan[/b] in Japanese.

title: queen_sectonia
body:
The true antagonist and final boss of [i][[Kirby: Triple Deluxe]][/i]. She is a giant, beauty-obsessed wasp queen who has been terrorizing the [[people of the sky]] well before the events of the main story. Said main story kicks off when the people have had enough of her tyranny and decide to summon a hero with the Dreamstalk.

Hearing about this rebellion, the twisted queen sends her trusted servant [[Taranza]] to capture this hero. When Taranza fails her by mistaking [[King Dedede]] as the hero (and thus incurring the wrath of [[Kirby]]), Sectonia supposedly offs her servant and takes matters into her own hands.

After a long, drawn-out battle [[flowered sectonia|(which included Sectonia fusing with the Dreamstalk)]], Kirby defeats her with his newly-discovered Hypernova [[copy_ability|ability]]. She has an additional form in The True Arena, called [[Soul of Sectonia]].

Queen Sectonia is implied to have looked much different in the past, less like a wasp, and more like [[Taranza]]. This form is referred to as [[Old Friend (kirby)|Old Friend]] in [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe]][/i]. 

[spoiler]As implied by the "Old Friend" moniker, flavor text from her boss fights, as well as Miiverse posts from [[Kumazaki Shin'ya]], confirm that she has not always been evil. In fact, she was rather benevolent to her people. It was thanks to constantly gazing in the [[Dimension Mirror]] (gifted to her by Taranza) that pushed her down the path of villainy. Whether or not [[Dark Meta Knight]] or [[Dark Mind]] (who is implied to be still alive in the form of King D-Mind) is responsible for this remains unknown.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]DNA informaton (courtesy of the Haltmann Works Company) suggests that she acquired her wasp form through magic and feeding off of countless hosts. When her clone is defeated in [i][[Kirby: Planet Robobot]][/i], she shows her base "Old Friend" form like the [[Dark Matter (kirby)|]] clone did for itself in the prior fight. Her appearance suggests that she and Taranza are of the same species and were even very close friends or lovers at some point.[/spoiler]

title: soul_of_sectonia
body: The much stronger form of [[Flowered Sectonia]], exclusively fought in the True Arena. May she rest in peace.

title: rinnegan
body:
The Rinnegan, as depicted in [[Naruto (classic)|]], is reputed as the most exalted eyes amongst the Three Great Dōjutsu, the others being the Byakugan and the Sharingan. They are characterised by light purple or red sclerae and irides with a ripple-pattern that spreads over the eyeball that are sometimes marked with tomoe.

Both of [[Uchiha Madara]]'s eyes eventually become this. Upon his impending death, his eyes are transplanted into a young [[Nagato (naruto)|]], who later exposes them via the use of the [[pain (Naruto)|Six Paths of Pain]]. After Nagato's demise and his unmasking, [[Uchiha Obito]]'s left eye socket is shown to have one of Madara's original Rinnegan implanted in it, and [[Uchiha Sasuke]]'s Eternal Mangekyou Sharingan is evolved into a powered up Rinnegan as he is visited by the Sage of the Six Paths while in near death.

h4. See also

* [[Rinne Sharingan]]

title: spiked_hair
body:
A term used to describe a variety of hairstyles in which the hair is formed into spikes. This hairstyle is largely seen on male characters from Shōnen manga and anime, though it is sometimes seen on females as well.

It is a youthful, messy and wild hairstyle. The artist [[Toriyama Akira]] was particularly known for his spiky-haired character designs, particularly in [[Dragon Ball Z]], where by the end of the series every protagonist even remotely relevant had some form of this hairstyle.

title: orochimaru_(naruto)
body:
[[Naruto (classic)|]] villain.

He is one of the Legendary Sannin along with [[Tsunade (naruto)|]] and [[Jiraiya (naruto)|]], all of whom trained under [[Sarutobi Hiruzen]] (The Third Hokage).

He has a subordinate in the form of Medical Ninja [[Yakushi Kabuto]] since moving to the Hidden Sound Village, wanting to find a new body for his soul.

It was then revealed that he wanted Hidden Leaf renegade [[Uchiha Sasuke]], who now moved to the Hidden Sound, as his vessel in the events of [[Naruto Shippuuden|Shippuden]].

His animal motif is a [[snake]], often seen by extending his neck to plant a Curse Mark on someone. He wields a weapon called the [[Sword of Kusanagi]] which he can either wield from his hand or, in the events of Shippuuden, spit out from inside his body. He has a giant snake that he can summon named Manda.

title: a_(naruto)
body:
A legacy of characters who bestows the title [b]Raikage[/b] in the [i][[Naruto (classic)|]][/i] franchise. They are the village chief of Kumogakure. His name is pronounced as "Ay".

The fourth Raikage has often been used in referring for the title. He is the son of the third Raikage, succeeding his father after his death.

Notorious in the Naruto fandom for his frequent appearance in [[netorare]] works, particularly with [[Hyuuga Hinata]].

title: kankurou_(naruto)
body:
A supporting character from [[Naruto (classic)|]].

He is a puppet master of the Hidden Sand Village, as is often depicted with his signature four-armed [[puppet]] named Karasu. As the series progresses, he gains another puppet, an insectoid puppet with a horse-like head named Kuroari; and a third one in [[Naruto Shippuuden|Shippuuden]], a newt-like puppet who can breathe fire named Sanshouou.

He is the first son of the Fourth Kazekage, and the second child among the other Sand siblings ([[Gaara (naruto)|]] and [[Temari (naruto)|]]).

title: sai_(naruto)
body:
Supporting character in [[Naruto (classic)|]]. He replaced [[Uchiha Sasuke]] and is now part of Team 7 with [[Hatake Kakashi]], [[Uzumaki Naruto]], [[Haruno Sakura]] and [[yamato_(naruto)|Yamato]].

He was trained to show no emotions. His drawings can awake and be used for several purposes, for example in fights or for mobility.

Sai's voice actor is [[Hino Satoshi]].

title: substitution_technique
body:
A common technique used by [[ninja]] to get out of trouble.  Just before being hit by an attack, the ninja disappears in a cloud of smoke, leaving behind an inanimate object in his place, most often a [[log]] of wood. 

Sometimes the log will be left wearing the ninja's clothing, while the ninja is left nude or nearly so.

While popularized by [[Naruto (classic)|]], this trope is not specific to that series, nor did it originate there.

h4. External links

* "TVTropes: Ninja Log":[https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NinjaLog]

title: uchiha_madara
body:
Character from [[Naruto (classic)|]]. A mighty shinobi from generations past, reputed as the strongest of the Uchiha.

Madara is usually depicted in his traditional [[Japanese armor]] and wielding his large [[gunbai]], with both of his [[Sharingan]] activated.

title: uchiha_sasuke
body: A major character in the anime/manga [[naruto (classic)|Naruto]]. A teammate of [[uzumaki_naruto|Uzumaki Naruto]] and [[haruno_sakura|Haruno Sakura]]. He became a rogue ninja in order to reap revenge on his older brother [[uchiha_itachi|Itachi]]. He is one of the last remaining members of the Uchiha Clan. Sasuke's voice actor is [[Sugiyama Noriaki]] in Japan, and [[Yuri Lowenthal ]] in the English dub.

title: a_bathing_ape
body:
A Japanese [[streetwear]] brand founded by Teriyaki Boyz member Nigo in 1993, opening a store named NOWHERE alongside fellow designer Jun Takahashi of Undercover. Popularized in the US by [[Kanye West]] in the early 2000s, the brand is most well known for it's [[shark hood|shark hoodies]], original [[camouflage|camo]] patterns, and their [[Baby Milo]] mascot. They have a more affordable offshoot brand in AAPE, and have had crossovers with numerous well known franchises including [[Naruto (classic)|]], [[One Piece]], [[Dragon Ball]], [[Gundam]], [[Transformers]], [[Star Wars]], and the [[Ultra series]], as well as many official collaborations with American rappers.

The brand was sold to Hong Kong fashion business conglomerate I.T Group in 2011. Nigo remained at the brand for 2 years before departing in 2013.

Informally known as BAPE.

h4. See Also

* [[Bapesta]]

* "Official Site (JP)":[https://bape.com/]

title: gudoudama_(naruto)
body:
Gudōdama (求道玉­), also known as Truth-Seeking Balls or Orbs, are black spheres of condensed chakra used by several characters in [[Naruto (classic)|]] as weapons.

"Naruto Wiki article":[https://naruto.fandom.com/wiki/Truth-Seeking_Ball]

title: forehead_protector
body:
A piece of protective gear for the forehead. May be in the form of a metal plate attached to a cloth [[headband]] (as in [i][[Naruto (classic)|]][/i], where most ninja wear such headgear with their village's [[Tag Group:Symbols|symbol]] engraved on it), an entirely metal headband or even a metal piece on the forehead which seemingly isn't held in place by anything at all (i.e. [[Leona (League of Legends)|Leona]] in [i][[League of Legends]][/i]).

h4. See Also

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: ao_(naruto)
body:
[[Naruto (classic)|]] character.

Do not add [b]青[/b] as a translated tag for this character, since it's a very common japanese kanji which is often used on pixiv to tag images with high prevalence of the [[blue]] color.

title: tsunade_(naruto)
body:
A supporting character in the anime/manga [[Naruto (classic)|]]. She is the best healer in the ninja world and one of the legendary Sannin, together with [[Jiraiya (naruto)|]] and [[Orochimaru (naruto)|]]. 

She is a compulsive gambler but has no luck. Her liegewoman is [[Shizune (Naruto)|]]. Although she is already 50 years old, she is able to look younger as long she has enough energy.

Her animal motif is a [[slug]], as seen in when she summons [[Katsuyu (naruto)|]].

h4. See also

* [[Tsunade_(jiraiya_gouketsu_monogatari)|]] ([[Jiraiya Gouketsu Monogatari]]) - her name's origin

title: kyuubi
body:
A [[fox]] (or [[fox girl]]) with [[multiple tails|nine tails]].

This is stated in Japanese lore to be the pinnacle of age and power for a [[kitsune]], and takes at least 800 years to attain, 100 years for each extra tail the kitsune grows as their power and age increases. Kyuubi are supposedly near-godlike in power. The Korean equivalent is called a [i]gumiho/kumiho[/i], while the Chinese equivalent is called a [i]huli jing[/i] (although, traditionally, kumiho are much more likely to be murderous and evil than playful and nice, and may not always have nine tails despite the hanja/hanji being that for "nine-tailed fox").

h4. Examples

* !post #4931287

h4. Notable Kyuubi

* [[Ahri (league of legends)|]] ([[League of Legends]])
* [[Akagi (azur lane)|]], [[Amagi (azur lane)|]], [[Kaga (azur lane)|]], [[Musashi (azur lane)|]], [[Shinano (azur lane)|]] and [[Tosa (azur lane)|]] ([[Azur Lane]])

title: sun_wukong
body:
Sun Wukong (孫 悟空 / 孙 悟空, [i]Sūn Wùkōng[/i], also known as The Monkey King in English and [i]Son Gokū[/i] in Japanese) is a character from the classical Chinese novel [[Journey to the West]]. He has been depicted in many different ways over the years.

His most notable weapon is the size-changing staff [[Ruyi Jingu Bang]], which also has its own various depictions in popular culture.

title: gaara_(naruto)
body:
A supporting character from [[Naruto (classic)|]] who fights with [[sand]]. His older siblings are [[kankurou (naruto)|Kankurou]] and [[Temari (naruto)|]]. The sign on his forehead means ''love''. 

[spoiler]
Firstly villain who just loved himself. Thanks to [[Uzumaki Naruto]] he learned true friendship.
[/spoiler]

He is then promoted to the title of Fifth Kazekage in the [[Naruto Shippuuden|Shippuuden]] timeline, and hopes to protect the village from any sign of destructions or villainy, but was ultimately defeated by Akatsuki member [[Deidara (naruto)|]]. Deidara and the rest of the Akatsuki would later seal the Shuukaku inside Gaara with the Genryuu Kyuu Fuujin.

title: tayuya_(naruto)
body:
A villain from [[Naruto (classic)|]] who goes by the title [b]Tayuya of the North Gate[/b] (北門の多由也 [i]Hokumon no Tayuya[/i]).

She is the sole female of the Sound Four manipulates demons of her creation using her Demon [[Flute]]. She can also manipulate said flute into projectiles and force fields.

title: rock_lee
body: Rock Lee (Japanese: ロック・リー) is a character in the anime and manga series [[Naruto (classic)|]] and [[Naruto Shippuuden]] created by [[Kishimoto Masashi]]. At first Masashi designed Lee to symbolize human strength. In the anime and manga, Lee is a [[ninja]] affiliated with the village of Konohagakure, and is a member of Team Guy, which consists of himself, [[Hyuuga Neji]], [[Tenten (Naruto)|]], and [[Might Guy]]—the team's leader. Unable to use most ninja techniques, Lee dedicates himself to using solely taijutsu, ninja techniques similar to martial arts. Lee dreams of becoming a "splendid ninja" despite his inabilities. Lee has appeared in several pieces of Naruto media, including the third and fourth featured films in the series, the third original video animation, and multiple video games.

title: sharingan
body:
A specific eye from [i][[Naruto (classic)|]][/i] series.

The Sharingan (literally meaning: Copy Wheel Eye, meaning (Viz): Mirror Wheel Eye) is the dōjutsu kekkei genkai of the Uchiha clan that appears selectively among its members.

It is regarded as one of the "Three Great Dōjutsu", the others being the [[Byakugan]] and the [[Rinnegan]].

While its powers originated from [[Ootsutsuki Kaguya]]'s [[Rinne Sharingan]], its independent form was first manifested by [[Ootsutsuki Indra]].

h4. See also

* [[Mangekyou Sharingan]]
* [[Tag Group:Eyes Tags]]

title: uchiha_itachi
body:
A villain from the [[Naruto (classic)|]] manga and anime series. Member of the Akatsuki group of criminals.

Being [[Uchiha Sasuke]]'s older brother, he perpetrated the massacre of his whole clan. He's well known for his [[Mangekyou Sharingan]], which can unleash Doujutsu and Genjutsu, the latter namely the Tsukuyomi no Sekai.

title: edo_tensei
body: In [[Naruto (classic)|]], Kuchiyose: Edo Tensei or Summoning: Impure World Reincarnation is a jutsu that can summon the dead as immortal zombie-like creatures to fight for the summoner. The reincarnated regenerate if damaged and possess infinite chakra, making them difficult to defeat. Someone who has been reincarnated with this technique has [[black sclera]] and [[cracked skin]].

title: naruto:_the_last

title: tsunade_(jiraiya_gouketsu_monogatari)
body:
Also known as Ogata Tsunade. A character from [[Jiraiya Gouketsu Monogatari]].

She is a mysterious beauty with superhuman strength who can use a xian magic to summon giant slugs. 

Jiraiya's toad, Orochimaru's snake and Tsunade's slug became the origin of "a Japanese idiom for ”three-way deadlock”":[http://tangorin.com/general/%E4%B8%89%E7%AB%A6%E3%81%BF]. (In Japanese folklore a slug is the natural enemy of snakes.)

h4.See also

* [[Ogata Shuuma Hiroyuki]] (Jiraiya)

* [[Tsunade (naruto)|]] ([[Naruto (classic)|]]) - Her counterpart in Naruto
* [[ninja]] - Later, their xian magics became considered as a type of ninja arts.

title: muuko_(go!_go!_gris!)
body:
A character from [[Vertigris]]'s ongoing manga series [[Go! Go! Gris!]].

Works for the company MaidMilk as head [[maid]], alongside [[muutsuki (go! go! gris!)|Muutsuki]]. Her full name is Muuko Tanaka.

Depicted as a [[cow girl]] [[maid]] with [[cow ears]], a [[black tail|black]] [[cow tail]], [[cow horns]], [[short hair|short]], [[bob cut|bobbed]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[black hair|black]] and [[pink hair]] with [[colored inner hair]], [[parted bangs]], [[sidelocks]], and [[eyebrows hidden by hair]], [[thick eyebrows]], [[pink eyes|pink]]/[[red eyes]], [[thick eyelashes|thick]], [[long eyelashes]], a [[mole under eye]] and [[mole on breast]], [[thick thighs]], [[wide hips]] and [[large breasts]]. Her primary costume consists of a [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[black dress|black]] and [[white dress|white]] [[collared dress|collared]], [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[short dress]] with [[cow print|cowprint]] elements, [[puffy short sleeves]], [[gold trim]], a [[cleavage cutout]], detached [[white wrist cuffs]], an [[underbust]] [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[waist ribbon]] with a [[pink bow|pink]] [[waist bow]], a [[white bow|white]] [[back bow]], a [[waist apron|waist]] [[maid apron]], [[pink pantyhose]], [[black shoes|black]] [[mary janes]], a [[maid headdress]] with a [[pink hairband]], and a [[pink collar|pink]] [[animal collar]] with a [[neck bell|neck]] [[cowbell]]. However, she is frequently shown wearing alternate costumes, such as [[maid]] [[playboy bunny]] costumes and [[cow print bikini|cowprint]] [[maid bikini|maid bikinis]].

title: muutsuki_(go!_go!_gris!)
body:
A character from [[Vertigris]]'s ongoing manga series [[Go! Go! Gris!]].

Works for the company MaidMilk as a [[maid]], alongside head [[maid]] [[muuko (go! go! gris!)|Muuko]].

Depicted as a [[cow girl]] [[maid]] with [[cow ears]], a [[brown tail|black]] [[cow tail]], [[cow horns]], [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] with [[hair over one eye]], [[parted bangs]], [[long sidelocks]] and [[eyebrows hidden by hair]], [[grey eyes]], [[thick eyelashes|thick]], [[long eyelashes]], a [[mole on ass]], [[thick thighs]], [[wide hips]] and [[large breasts]]. No reference costume for her exists; however, she is almost always depicted as wearing an identical costume to [[muuko (go! go! gris!)|Muuko]].

title: kara_(go!_go!_gris!)
body:
A character from [[Vertigris]]'s ongoing manga series [[Go! Go! Gris!]].

Tenant of [[boss (go! go! gris!)|Boss]] and roommates with [[gris (go! go! gris!)|Gris]] and [[perl (go! go! gris!)|Perl]]. Is the older sister of [[viska (go! go! gris!)|Viska]].

Depicted as a [[cat girl]] with [[cat ears]] and [[extra ears]], a [[spotted fur|spotted]] [[grey tail|grey]] [[cat tail]], [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with [[black streaks]], [[hair over one eye]], [[parted bangs]], [[eyebrows hidden by hair]] and [[sidelocks]], [[yellow eyes]] with [[slit pupils]], [[thick eyelashes|thick]], [[long eyelashes]], [[stud earrings]], and [[large breasts]]. Often (but not always) depicted with [[one-piece tan|one-piece swimsuit tanlines]]. Her primary outfit consists of a [[white sports bra]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[two-tone jacket|two-tone]] [[black jacket|black]] and [[yellow jacket|yellow]] [[hooded jacket|hooded]], [[zipper|zip-up]] [[jacket]], [[black shoes|black]] [[sneakers]], and [[white socks|white]] [[ankle socks]]. Frequently depicted with [[half-closed eyes]], [[tsurime]], [[raised eyebrows]], a [[light blush]], and a [[seductive smile|seductive]] [[grin]].

title: viska_(go!_go!_gris!)
body:
A character from [[Vertigris]]'s ongoing manga series [[Go! Go! Gris!]].

A [[mafia]] princess, and estranged younger sister and [[rivalry|rival]] to [[kara (go! go! gris!)|Kara]]. Almost always accompanied by multiple identical-looking, [[suit|suited]] [[cat boy]] [[bodyguard|bodyguards]]/minions.

Depicted as a [[cat girl]] with [[cat ears]] and [[extra ears]], a [[spotted fur|spotted]] [[grey tail|grey]] [[cat tail]], [[long hair|long]], [[twintails|twintailed]] [[grey hair]] with [[black streaks]], [[eyebrows hidden by hair]], [[hair between eyes]], [[sidelocks]] and [[hair intakes]], [[yellow eyes]] with [[slit pupils]], [[thick eyelashes|thick]], [[long eyelashes]], [[pearl earrings]], [[blue nails]], and [[small breasts]]. Her primary outfit consists of a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]], [[short dress|short]], [[black dress|black]] [[cocktail dress|cocktail]] [[pencil dress]] with a [[side slit]] and [[covered navel]], a [[two-tone coat|two-tone]] [[black coat|black]] and [[blue coat]] worn as a [[coat on shoulders|coat cape]], a [[pearl necklace]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[stiletto heels]]. Commonly depicted with a haughty, [[smug]] expression, with [[tsurime]], [[narrowed eyes|narrowed]], [[half-closed eyes]], [[v-shaped eyebrows]], and a [[fang|fanged]] smile.

title: gris_(go!_go!_gris!)
body:
The main and title character of [[Vertigris]]'s ongoing manga series [[Go! Go! Gris!]], as well as his primary mascot and OC. Notable for spawning the [[Gris Swimsuit]] meme/trend.

Tenant of [[boss (go! go! gris!)|Boss]] and roommates with [[kara (go! go! gris!)|Kara]] and [[perl (go! go! gris!)|Perl]]. Is an orphan, with no known parents or biological family. Her best friend is [[perl (go! go! gris!)|Perl]].

Depicted as a [[bear girl]] with [[bear ears]] and [[extra ears]], a [[blue tail|blue]] [[bear tail]], [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] styled in a [[bob cut]] with [[blunt bangs|blunt]], [[double-parted bangs]], [[blunt sidelocks]], [[blunt ends]], [[hair intakes]], [[eyebrows hidden by hair]] and a [[short ponytail]] [[half updo]], [[pink eyes|pink]]/[[red eyes]], [[thick eyelashes|thick]], [[long eyelashes]] and [[small breasts]]. Her primary outfit consists of a [[white dress|white]], [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[short dress]], a [[black choker]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[two-tone jacket|two-tone]] [[black jacket|black]] and [[pink jacket|pink]] [[hooded jacket|hooded]], [[buttons|button-up]] [[jacket]] with [[sleeves past wrists]], [[blue shoes|blue]] [[slip-on shoes]], [[kneehighs|kneehigh]] [[white socks]], and [[blue leg warmers|blue legwarmers]]. Frequently depicted with an [[:D]] expression, single [[fang]], and [[tareme]].

title: perl_(go!_go!_gris!)
body:
A character from [[Vertigris]]'s ongoing manga series [[Go! Go! Gris!]].

Tenant of [[boss (go! go! gris!)|Boss]] and roommates with [[gris (go! go! gris!)|Gris]] and [[kara (go! go! gris!)|Kara]]. Her best friend is [[gris (go! go! gris!)|Gris]].

Depicted as a [[mouse girl|rat girl]] with [[mouse ears|rat ears]] and [[extra ears]], a [[mouse tail|rat tail]], [[short hair|short]], [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[white hair|white]] and [[pink hair|pink]] [[flipped hair]] with [[colored tips]], an [[ahoge]], [[double-parted bangs]], [[hair between eyes]], [[hair intakes]], [[eyebrows hidden by hair]] and [[sidelocks]], [[green eyes]], [[bags under eyes]], [[multiple piercings|multiple]] [[ear piercing|ear piercings]], [[thick eyelashes|thick]], [[long eyelashes]] and [[small breasts]]. Her primary outfit consists of a [[two-tone hoodie|two-tone]] [[white hoodie|white]] and [[green hoodie|green]] [[long hoodie]] with [[sleeves past wrists]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[turtleneck shirt]], [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts]], [[white socks|white]] [[ankle socks]], and [[white sandals|white]] [[slides]].

title: boss_(go!_go!_gris!)
body:
A character from [[Vertigris]]'s ongoing manga series [[Go! Go! Gris!]].

Landlord of [[gris (go! go! gris!)|Gris]], [[kara (go! go! gris!)|Kara]], and [[perl (go! go! gris!)|Perl]]. His real name is currently unknown. His prized possession is a red [[Kei truck]].

Depicted with [[blonde hair|blonde]], [[short hair|short]], [[spiked hair]], fashioned into a [[crew cut]] with two [[antenna hair|antennae locks]] and [[sideburns]], [[sideburns stubble]], [[sparse stubble|sparse]] [[goatee stubble]], [[mismatched eyebrows|mismatched]] black, [[thick eyebrows|bushy eyebrows]], two [[broken horns]], [[one-eyed]] with a [[scar across eye]], a black [[single earring]] and a [[mature male|mature]], [[muscular male|muscular]], [[plump]] build with a [[strongman waist]], [[belly]], [[broad shoulders]], and [[body hair]]. Most frequently depicted wearing a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[black shirt|black]] [[t-shirt]] or a [[black kimono]], [[shirt tucked in|tucked into]] [[black pants|black]]/[[blue pants|dark blue]] [[hakama pants]] and [[brown sandals|brown]] [[flip-flops]], and sporting a stern expression with [[v-shaped eyebrows]], a [[cigarette]] or [[stalk in mouth]], [[narrowed eyes|narrowed]] or [[=_=]] eyes, and [[clenched teeth]].

title: kozume_kenma
body:
Kozume Kenma is a character from [[Haikyuu!!]]
He a second-year student from Nekoma High and plays as a setter for the boys [[volleyball]] team.

Kenma is depicted with an average height, a small build, and has an unsteady posture. He has many outstanding features, including his cat-like [[yellow eyes|golden eyes]] and [[blonde hair|blond hair]] with [[two-tone hair|black roots]]. He dresses casually, and his Nekoma [[volleyball uniform|uniform]] is the standard black and red jersey. He is usually seen carrying a [[handheld game console|portable game console]] and a [[cellphone]] with him.

title: meta_ridley
body:
[[Ridley]] as he appears in [i][[Metroid Prime 1]][/i], resuscitated and [[cyborg|cybernetically enhanced]] after his defeat in [[metroid_(classic)|Metroid]]/[[Metroid: Zero Mission]]. Much of his organics are replaced with machinery. 

His wings are now [[orange wings|orange]] or [[yellow wings|yellow]] and much of his body is covered in metal armor plating, from parts of his head to his neck all the way through his torso and tail. However parts of his arms and legs are still unprotected in armor and show organic skin covering. His [[orange eyes]] now [[glowing_eyes|glow]] more consistently compared to other iterations.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25482805: Original
* !asset #25482811: Remastered

title: space_pirate_(metroid)
body:
Hostile group featured in the [[Metroid]] series. They are militarized [[alien]]s that raid space vessels, conquer planets and utilize bioweapons. They are responsible for many galactic crises, like the weaponization of [[Metroid (creature)|]]s. 

They take various appearances throughout the games, but the most common one are the [[Zebesian]]s from Planet Zebes.

title: omega_pirate
body: A boss in [[Metroid Prime 1]], fought in the Phazon Mines. It is the pinnacle of the Elite Pirates program "Project Helix", [[Space Pirate (metroid)|]]s who were infused with [[Phazon]] within it's DNA.

title: dark_samus
body:
A being of [[Phazon]] taking on the shape of [[Samus Aran]]. She made a brief cameo appearance in the secret ending of [[Metroid Prime 1]], was a central character in [[Metroid Prime 2: Echoes]], and was the main antagonist in [[Metroid Prime 3: Corruption]].

After Samus defeated the [[Metroid Prime (creature)|]] on Tallon IV by absorbing Phazon and using it as a weapon against Metroid Prime, the creature began to destabilize, and in a desperate move, it absorbed her [[Phazon Suit]] and subsequently exploded. As Samus left the planet, a new creature was born from Samus' DNA and the remains of Metroid Prime, using Samus' Phazon Suit as a mold to contain its new body - the creature known as Dark Samus.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25450106: Metroid Prime 2: Echoes
* !asset #25450109: Metroid Prime 2: Echoes (Second form)
* !post #3217758: Metroid Prime 3: Corruption

title: metroid
body:
The [b]Metroid[/b] ([b]メトロイド[/b]) games are a series of video games produced by [[Nintendo]]. One of the company's most successful franchises, the [[science fiction]] series spans through several Nintendo systems, with the first game, Metroid, released in 1986 for the Famicon and in 1987 for the [[nes|Nintendo Entertainment System]]. 

The Metroid games chronicle the missions of bounty hunter [[Samus Aran]] in a [[science fiction]] setting which contains many similarities to the [[Alien (1979)|]] film franchise. Central plot elements are the [[Metroid (creature)|]] organisms and the [[Space Pirate (metroid)|]]s which try to exploit the Metroids' powers. The gameplay combines adventure based on exploration and item-gathering with platformer and shooter dynamics. The Metroid games are famous for their nonlinear gameplay, where one can complete a game with a fraction of the items available in the game. 

For the titular alien lifeform, use the [[Metroid (Creature)]] tag.

h4. List of games

* [[Metroid (classic)|Metroid (NES)]]
* [[Metroid 2: Return of Samus|Metroid II: Return of Samus]] (GB)
* [[Super Metroid]] (SNES)
* [[Metroid Fusion]] (GBA)
* [[Metroid Prime 1]] (GC)
* [[Metroid Prime 2: Echoes]] (GC)
* [[Metroid: Zero Mission]] (GBA)
* [[Metroid Prime Hunters]] (NDS)
* [[Metroid Prime 3: Corruption]] (Wii)
* Metroid Prime Trilogy (Wii)
* [[Metroid: Other M]] (Wii)
* [[Metroid Prime: Federation Force]] (3DS)
* [[Metroid: Samus Returns]] (3DS)
* [[Metroid Dread]] (Switch)
* [[Metroid Prime 4: Beyond]] (Switch)

title: parasite_queen
body:
The first boss in [[Metroid Prime 1]], fought in the Frigate Orpheon. 

A female Parasite, indigenous to Tallon IV, that was enlarged and enhanced due to [[Phazon]] experiments by the [[Space Pirate (metroid)|]]s.

title: greg_luzniak
body: Greg Luzniak was an artist at Retro Studios during [[Metroid Prime 1]]'s development.

title: metroid_prime_3:_corruption
body: The last entry in the Metroid Prime trilogy, revolving around [[samus aran|Samus]]'s fight against [[Dark Samus]]. The first [[Metroid]] game released for the [[Wii]], it was later re-released alongside the [[metroid prime 1|prior]] [[metroid prime 2: echoes|two]] games as part of the Metroid Prime Trilogy collection.

title: phazon_suit
body:
The final [[power suit (metroid)|]] upgrade from [[Metroid Prime 1]], this suit is shaped like the standard [[Varia Suit]] but colored black and silver with a red visor and trim, and provides protection against the radiation emitted by [[Phazon]]. When [[samus_aran|Samus]] defeats the titular [[metroid_prime_(creature)|Metroid Prime]], [spoiler]it steals the suit and turns into [[Dark Samus]].[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance
* !asset #23452793

title: help:pokemon_tags
body:
These are the standards concerning the various kinds of [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] tags.

h4. Tagging human characters
* Use English names for human characters, with the (pokemon) qualifier.
** Ex.: [[sabrina_(pokemon)]], [[brock_(pokemon)]], etc.
* Use English names for trainer classes, with the (pokemon) qualifier.
** Ex.: [[lass_(pokemon)]], [[swimmer_(pokemon)]], [[fisher_(pokemon)]], etc.
* As an exception, human characters with surnames don't have the qualifier.
** Ex.: [[tracey_sketchit]], [[blue_oak]], etc. (not [[blue_oak_(pokemon)]])

Pokémon tags were formerly partly grandfathered-in tags, where human characters were originally referred to by their Japanese names in compliance with usual Danbooru standards, despite having English names on exported versions. The English names were sometimes available as aliases, especially in the case of major characters such as players and rivals. However, as raised in topic #17160, this created an inconsistency with the use of the English names of the Pokémon themselves and other terms used in the franchise as well as several other factors that had to be addressed, thus the reversal, marking Pokémon tags as completely grandfathered-in copyright tags. See our [[howto:copyright|Copyright Tag Guidelines]] for more info about "grandfathered-in copyright tags".

Most human characters are known by a single name (they lack a full name) such as "Misty" and would be likely ambiguous with characters from other copyrights, hence the (pokemon) qualifier.

Trainer classes are often descriptive words such as "Swimmer" or "Lass", so English trainer classes are used. They would often clash with common English vocabulary, so the (pokemon) qualifier is used here as well.

See [[List of Pokemon characters|List of Pokémon characters]] for all names.

h4. Tagging Pokémon species
* Simply use the English names of Pokémon species.
** Ex.: [[pikachu]], [[mewtwo]], etc.
* There are ten species that require the (pokemon) qualifier:
** [[gloom_(pokemon)]], [[golem_(pokemon)]],  [[electrode_(pokemon)]], [[kabuto_(pokemon)]], [[mew_(pokemon)]], [[roselia_(pokemon)]], [[deino_(pokemon)]], [[chi-yu_(pokemon)]], [[ting-lu_(pokemon)]] and [[iron_hands_(pokemon)]].

* For a regional form, use just "alolan_(species)", "galarian_(species)", "hisuian_(species)" or "paldean_(species)". Don't use just "(species)".
** Ex.: Alolan Meowth should be tagged just [[alolan_meowth]], not [[meowth]].
** Ex.: Galarian Meowth should be tagged just [[galarian_meowth]], not [[meowth]].
** Ex.: Hisuian Braviary should be tagged just [[hisuian_braviary]], not [[braviary]].
** Ex.: Paldean Wooper should be tagged just [[paldean_wooper]], not [[wooper]].

Owing to their sheer number (1025 registered species, as of the Scarlet and Violet versions), remembering their English names is no easy task, much less their Japanese names. The Japanese names of Pokémon also cover many highly-ambiguous words that can and will conflict with other characters, artists, and objects. (Beedrill = "Spear" in Japanese; Magnemite = "Coil" in Japanese, etc.)

Historically, Japanese names had been applicable to newer Pokémon as temporary tags, when necessary, until their English names became officially available. However, in the latest generations, the English and Japanese names have been usually released at the same time.

Some miscellaneous tags about Pokémon species, such as [[shiny_pokemon]] and [[clothed_pokemon]], are also available.

See [[list_of_pokemon|List of Pokémon]] for all names.

h4. Tagging media

* Use game tags to group human characters and designs from various games.
** Ex.: [[pokemon_rgby]], [[pokemon_sm]], [[pokemon_swsh]], etc.
* Use anime series tags to group human characters and designs from different anime series.
** Ex.: [[pokemon_(classic_anime)]], [[pokemon_dppt_(anime)]], [[pokemon_sm_(anime)]], etc.
* Other media tags are available as well:
** Ex.: [[pokemon_adventures]], [[pokemon_pocket_monsters]], etc.
* Make sure to check the different designs of each character to see where it fits.
** Ex.: Red is visibly different in [i]RGBY[/i], [i]FRLG[/i], [i]SM[/i], and [i]LGPE[/i], so various posts depicting Red are expected to have different media tags. Many game characters also have different designs when they appear in remakes.
* In the vast majority of cases, don't use game tags for Pokémon species.
** Ex.: Posts depicting a Squirtle should not be tagged [[pokemon_rgby]] (unless there are human characters from that game in the post as well). All the same, posts depicting a [[Wooloo]] should not be tagged [[pokemon_swsh]].
* As an exception, [[official art]] posts depicting a Pokémon may use game tags.
** Ex.: Official art of Charizard from FRLG may be tagged [[pokemon_frlg]]. Official art of Wooloo from SwSh may be tagged [[pokemon_swsh]].

A post depicting a Pokémon species is not necessarily a visible reference to any game in particular.

For instance, adding [[pokemon_swsh]] to a Wooloo post (post #3528342) would be a mistake, because Wooloo is expected to appear in other media as well.

Discussion: topic #15030.

See [[List of Pokemon media|List of Pokémon media]] for all forms of media.

h4. Prototype Pokémon

Prototype Pokémon are the unused Pokémon designs and creatures. They sometimes appear in fan art.

* All prototype Pokémon have their own tags and don't use normal Pokémon tags. Examples:
** post #3360231 - the correct tag is [[girafarig_(prototype)]], not [[girafarig]].
** post #3355587 - the correct tag is [[gyarados_(prototype)]], not [[gyarados]].
** post #3148107 - the correct tag is [[rai_(raikou)]], not [[raikou]].
** post #3148591 - the correct tag is [[leafy_(leafeon)]], not [[leafeon]].
* Prototype versions having the same names as normal Pokémon have the (prototype) qualifier.
** Ex.: [[igglybuff_(prototype)]] (to distinguish from the normal [[igglybuff]]), [[gyarados_(prototype)]], [[pichu_(prototype)]], [[girafarig_(prototype)]], etc.
* Whenever possible, use a name found in official sources (which are usually in Japanese).
** Ex.: Some prototype Pokémon have been found, with their respective names, in the [i]Gold[/i]/[i]Silver[/i] from Space World 1997: Hanamogura, Honooguma, Volbear, Dynabear, etc.
* Don't use fan translations as tags. Stick to the "official" Japanese names as said above. (sometimes fanart and fan sites use fan translations, but please ignore them) Feel free to mention major fan translations in the wiki pages (such as those by The Cutting Room Floor).
** Ex.: The website The Cutting Room Floor translated the Pokémon names from Space World 1997: Koonya (original) became Meowsy (fan translation), Haneko (original) became Lefmew (fan translation), etc.
* A prototype Pokémon is often found in a single game and is unlikely to appear in other games and media such as anime and manga, so it may use the normal game tag, as well as the prototype game tag.
** Ex.: All posts depicting [[pichu_(prototype)]] should be tagged [[pokemon_gsc]], as well as [[pokemon_gsc_(prototype)]].

Lists of prototype Pokémon:
* [[pokemon_rgby_(prototype)]]
* [[pokemon_gsc_(prototype)]]
* [[pokemon_rse_(prototype)]]
* [[pokemon_dppt_(prototype)]]

For record album cover art, use [[album cover]].

title: tom_chin_cheng_hanji_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from a segment of [[Tom and Jerry]] from the 1940s.

The original scene shows [[tom (tom and jerry)|Tom the Cat]] being squashed by a vinyl [[vinyl record]] and transformed into a [[racism|stereotypical]] depiction of [[China|Chinese]] people (sharp eyes, large belly, and with a [[fu manchu (mustache)|]] mustache) while spinning on the [[phonograph]].

* !asset #25420683: Original scene (click to view the animation).

The meme is usually accompanied with the song ""If You Feel My Love (Chaow MIX)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uMEU2Jpj0Y4]", specifically the segment with a sample of Beijing Opera "Chen Shimei and Qin Xianglian".

title: sound_burger
body:
A model of portable [[phonograph]] released by [[Audio-Technica]] in 1983, and rereleased in an updated format in 2022. The Sound Burger has a distinct rectangular appearance, with a semicircular portion to house the motor to play [[vinyl record]]s.

title: turntable
body:
A turntable is a modern [[phonograph]], also known as a record player or record machine. They are a popular machine commonly used by [[DJ|Disc Jockeys]]. Turntables are distinguished from older phonographs by the fact that they have electrical pickups instead of a purely mechanical one. 

[b]Note:[/b] If a phonograph is basically flat and has a mobile arm, it's probably a turntable. If it has a cone, or a tube-style fixed arm, it isn't.

h4. See also

* [[vinyl record]]
* [[mixing console]]
* [[nightclub]]
* [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

title: dvalin_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character in [[Genshin Impact]].

Dvalin, also referred to as Stormterror, is a giant blue and turquoise dragon with six wings and two horns on its head. Dvalin has deep ties with Mondstadt and the Anemo Archon, once acting as one of Mondstadt's primary guardians.

Early in the story, two purple spikes are present on the back of Dvalin's neck. [spoiler]These spikes are the corrupted blood of the dragon [[durin (real) (genshin impact)|Durin]], who Dvalin defeated hundreds of years ago. These spikes are removed by the player in the first arc of the game.[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

* !post #8973031

title: jill_ratokie
body:
A fictional [[child|underage]] character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He appears in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] TV anime series from 1979.

[b]Jill Ratokie[/b] is the brother of [[Miharu Ratokie]] and [[Milly Ratokie]]. [spoilers]Some years after Miharu's death and the end of [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]] he joins the [[titans_(gundam)|Titan]]'s Cyber-Newtype Murasame program (along with [[Four Murasame]]) but is killed as his body is unable to cope with the tremendous mental energy overload of the Psycommu system onboard the [[Psycho Gundam]].[/spoilers]

title: quin_mantha
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] form the [[Gundam]] [[science fiction]] mechaverse. It first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] anime TV series from 1986.

[b]NZ-000 Quin Mantha[/b]

Also called the Queen Mansa. A Newtype use gigantic [[Mobile Suit]], taking on design cues from other similar [[Neo Zeon]] MSs and MAs such as the [[Qubeley]], [[Psycho Gundam]] and [[Zeong]]. It has very powerful beam weapons and was piloted by [[Puru Two]] and [[Glemy Toto]] at one point.

Its design would later be refined into the NZ-666 [[Kshatriya]], piloted by [[Marida Cruz]].

title: selena:_capriccio_(irisfall_ballad)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Selena (pgr)|]]'s [[selena: capriccio (pgr)|Capriccio frame]].

A coating released with the Capriccio frame itself, Irisfall Ballad is a formal [[white dress|white]] [[backless dress]] with [[detached collar|detached]] [[white collar]] with [[frilled skirt]] with a band of [[see-through skirt layer]]  underneath. Other clothing elements such as a [[blue bow|blue]] [[back bow]] that is detached and floating, and a pair of [[white gloves]].

Has similar physical appearance as the default coating, Irisfall Ballad kept her [[purple eyes]] and [[black hair]], hair style is now a [[updo]] [[hair bun]] with [[side braid]]s, adorned with [[pearl hair ornament|pearl]] and [[feather hair ornament]]s, wears a [[single earring|single]] [[floating earrings|dangle earring]] with [[pearl earrings|pearl]] [[blue gemstone]] and a [[cross earrings|cross]] ornament. On top of her left arm being [[single mechanical arm|mechanical]], her right leg now also [[single mechanical leg|mechanical]].

title: vanitas_(vanitas_no_carte)
body:
Title character as well as one of the main characters in [[Vanitas no Carte]].

[b]Vanitas[/b] is a [[doctor]] who specializes in [[vampire]]s. He is an average human being who inherited his name and the Book of Vanitas from the infamous vampire.

He has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] (that may appear [[blue hair|blue]] due to coloring) tied into a [[low ponytail]] with [[hair between eyes]]. His default outfit included a [[black coat]], [[blue bowtie|blue]] [[striped bowtie]], [[blue vest|blue]] [[striped vest]] on top of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[blue sash]] tied into a [[waist bow]], [[black pants]], [[black gloves]] and [[white shirt|white]] [[boots]]. He also wears an [[hourglass]]-shaped [[floating earrings|dangle]] [[single earring]].
