title: spartan:_total_warrior
body:
Spartan: Total Warrior is a 2005 hack and slash game for GameCube, PlayStation 2, and Xbox. Developed by Creative Assembly and published by Sega, it was released on all platforms in October. It is a spin-off of the [[Total War]] series.

The game tells an ahistorical story focusing on the "Spartan", a Spartan warrior fighting alongside his Greek allies against the invading Roman Empire. An orphan with no knowledge of his true identity, Spartan is secretly guided by Ares, who has promised him aid during the conflict, and information as to his identity after it. In return, Spartan must help Ares achieve an unspecified revenge on someone.

Total Warrior is the only installment in the Total War series to have been released for video game consoles rather than PCs or Macs. It was the first Total War game published by Sega. The game originated in an examination of whether or not it would be possible to make a "true" Total War game work on a console. When Creative Assembly realised it would not, they decided to go in a different direction; making an action game within the traditions of the series, but one that would push console hardware to its limits.

title: ice_cream_scoop_(utensil)
body:
A spoon-like utensil used primarily for serving [[ice cream]]. It has a hemispherical bowl designed to shape ice cream into rounded scoops. Some mechanical designs have a lever that helps release the ice cream.

Don't confuse this for the actual ball of ice cream. See any of the below for those:

* [[single scoop]]
* [[multiple scoops]]
* [[too many scoops]]

h4.See also

* [[cone holder]]
* [[ice cream cup]]
* [[ice cream spoon]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: single_scoop
body:
When only one scoop of [[ice cream]] is on an [[ice cream cone]] or in a bowl.

h4.See also

* [[multiple scoops]]
* [[too many scoops]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: tsubasa_la_liberte
body:
A song from [[Link! Like! Love Live!]], first performed by the Hasu no Sora Jogakuin School Idol Club in the November 2023 Fes×LIVE.

[spoiler]In-universe, it was originally written by [[Ogami Sachi]].[/spoiler]

title: cerise_bouquet
body:
One of three units formed within the [[link! like! love live!|Hasu no Sora Jogakuin School Idol Club]], passed down through tradition in the club's history. 
Their songs tend towards cheery and elegant J-pop.

Its current members are [[Hinoshita Kaho]] and [[Momose Ginko]].

It features a [[blue sweater vest]], [[short sleeves]], and occasionally [[twin braids]].

title: manboobs
body: For fatty or breast-like looking [[pectorals]]. Sometimes with puffy or raised nipples. Although this condition (adipomastia) is normally found on [[fat_man|overweight men]] (post #6115619), it is also a fetish name used for slimmer men with [[male_with_breasts|feminine breasts]] (post #5044172, post #5025833) or muscular men with defined and round [[pectorals]] (post #4072298, post #4123358). It is also not to be confused with [[gynecomastia]], which occurs specifically due to hormonal imbalance. Adipomastia is also known as pseudogynecomastia for exactly this reason. Do not tag with [[muscular male]] or [[toned male]] unless the body is viable and proportional with the chest size. Otherwise just the [[manboobs]] tag will suffice. * !post #5488282: Pectorals squeezed together to form manboobs. * !post #6115619: Overweight natural manboobs.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[swept bangs]] & [[hair between eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[brown eyes]]. title: gudaguda_final_honnouji_2019
body:
[b]Myriad Worlds of Nobunaga: De Arca[br]All-Out Nobunaga Assault - GUDAGUDA Final Honnouji 2019[/b]
[quote]You are suddenly hurled into the Warring States period, a time when rival lords fought for control of Japan.
Okay, that's not really anything new, but it seems like things are a little different from what you remember in the history books...

The epic, unprecedented, and completely ridiculous battle...begins![/quote]

A limited time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] serving as a collaboration with [[Koha-Ace]], released on the Japanese server on July 4, 2019 and on the NA server on June 20, 2021. [[Nagao Kagetora (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

h4. Characters
Slightly different scenarios play out depending on if the player is currently with [[Chaldea Security Organization]] (only played Arc 1/Arc 1.5) or [[Novum Chaldea]] (cleared up through the [[S I N (fate/grand order)|]]
prologue).

title: gudaguda_teito_seihai_kitan
body:
[b]Isolated Realm of the Far East: Imperial Capital[br]GUDAGUDA Legend of the Imperial Capital Grail ~Far East Demonic Front 1945~[/b]
[quote]A peculiar Singularity has been observed in the year 1945, located in the Far East.
A new legend of the Holy Grail is woven after an encounter with a mysterious Heroic Spirit.
With the Imperial Capital mired in...shenanigans, a new Holy Grail War begins!

But what is it that now approaches this land: A god, or a demon...?[/quote]

A limited time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] serving as a collaboration with [[Koha-Ace]], released on the Japanese server on June 13, 2018 and on the NA server on June 3, 2020. [[Sakamoto Ryouma (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

title: ulrika_magdova_straghov
body:
Uirika Magdova Straghov is the daughter of Ivan Mikelovitch Straghov, one of the [[Kislev|Kislevite]] march boyars who guards the borders of that frigid realm against the depredations of [[Chaos_(Warhammer)|]]. She is a tall, independent woman, as ferocious in combat as any man, skilled with the bow, and an accomplished horsewoman.

Felix Jaeger first met Ulrika on the Dwarf airship Spirit of Grungni, as they flew to the far north in search of the lost Dwarf stronghold of Karag Dum. He was immediately attracted by her stunning looks and confident nature, so different from most Imperial women. Their affair proved to be passionate but stormy, until circumstances drove them apart.

Ulrika was later transformed into a Lahmian Vampire by her sire Adolphus Krieger and took part in many adventures across the Old World in the years before the End Times.

https://warhammerfantasy.fandom.com/wiki/Ulrika_Magdova_Straghov

title: princess_shokora
body:
The true ruler of the Golden Pyramid and the damsel in distress in [i][[Wario Land 4]][/i]. Long ago she was peacefully laid to rest under the pyramid until the [[Golden Diva]], in her greed, took residence of the pyramid, all of its treasures and cursed the ruins, [spoilers]transforming Shokora into a [[black cat (wario land)|shape-shifting]] [[shop owner (wario land)|entity]][/spoilers].

She shares some design elements with [[Princess Peach]], having a golden [[crown]], [[blue eyes]], blue [[sphere earrings]], and a [[pink dress|pink]] [[long dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]]. She also has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair|reddish hair]] (more [[pink hair|pinkish]] in the in-game sprite), wears golden [[bangle|bangles]] and [[pink gloves|pink]] [[elbow gloves]].

[spoiler]Depending on the number of chests Wario has collected, the design Shokora will transform into will differ. If one or no chests were collected, she turns into a [[baby]]. If two to five chests were collected, she appears as a large, hideous woman with a big nose, resembling Wario's [[man face|ugly face]]. If six to eleven chests were collected, she appears a young woman with long hair and a princess's dress, resembling her official art. If all twelve chests were collected, her true form is shown as a slender and matured woman with shorter hair and a cape. See asset #24265333 for a look at every form Shokora can take in the ending.[/spoiler]

The word Shokora derives from the French word for "Chocolate".

h4. Official Art

* !post #7517663

title: pegi
body:
PEGI, short for [B]Pan-European Game Information[/B], is the European rating system for video games. 

This tag refers to the content rating logos themselves. The ratings are as follows:

[b]PEGI 3:[/b] The content of games with a PEGI 3 rating is considered suitable for all age groups. The game should not contain any sounds or pictures that are likely to frighten young children. A very mild form of violence (in a comical context or a childlike setting) is acceptable. No bad language should be heard.

[b]PEGI 7:[/b] Game content with scenes or sounds that can possibly be frightening to younger children should fall in this category. Very mild forms of violence (implied, non-detailed, or non-realistic violence) are acceptable for a game with a PEGI 7 rating.

[b]PEGI 12:[/b] Video games that show violence of a slightly more graphic nature towards fantasy characters or non-realistic violence towards human-like characters would fall in this age category. Sexual innuendo or sexual posturing can be present, while any bad language in this category must be mild.

[b]PEGI 16:[/b] This rating is applied once the depiction of violence (or sexual activity) reaches a stage that looks the same as would be expected in real life. The use of bad language in games with a PEGI 16 rating can be more extreme, while the use of tobacco, alcohol or illegal drugs can also be present.

[b]PEGI 18:[/b] The 18 rating, which indicates content suitable only for adults, is applied when the level of violence reaches a stage where it becomes a depiction of gross violence, apparently motiveless killing, or violence towards defenceless characters. The glamorisation of the use of illegal drugs, explicit sexual activity, and gambling should also fall into this age category.

h4. See also
* [[CERO]] (Computer Entertainment Rating Organization) for the Japanese rating system.
* [[ESRB]] (Entertainment Software Ratings Board) for the US rating system.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PEGI
* "Official website":[https://pegi.info/]

title: chiitan
body:
A genderless 0 year old fairy baby otter who wears a turtle as a hat that was the self-proclaimed [[yuru-chara]] of the small Japanese port city of Susaki. Best known for their quirky YouTube videos and social media posts performing a variety of awkward and violent stunts.

In May 2019, Chiitan lost all of their original Twitter accounts, suspected to be a result of the controversial nature of their antics, prompting the creation of new accounts. 2019 was also marked by legal threats of copyright infringement from Susaki officials beginning in February, which would be dismissed in September.

title: nose_picking
body: The act sticking something (usually a finger) up a character's nose.

title: morva_(fire_emblem)
body:
A boss from [[Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones]].

Morva (ムルヴァ, Muruva) is the foster father to [[Myrrh (fire emblem)|]], and watches over the Demon King's body in Darkling Woods.

title: doom_i
body:
A 1993 first-person shooter [[video game]] developed by [[id Software]] for the MS-DOS operating system. It was ported to many video game systems, and in recent times, it is popularly known to be playable [[it runs doom (meme)|on anything]].

In the game a lone space marine (the [[Doomguy]]) fights [[demon]]s using high-tech weaponry. 

Doom is often credited with popularizing the first-person shooter (FPS) game genre.

h4. Monsters

* [[Zombieman (doom)|]]
* Shotgun guy
* [[Pinky Demon]]
* Spectre
* [[Baron of Hell]]
* [[Cacodemon]]
* [[Lost Soul (doom)|]]
* [[Spider Mastermind]]
* [[Cyberdemon]]

h4. See also

* [[Doom (series)]]
* [[Doom II]]
* [[Doom 64]]
* [[Legacy of Rust]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Doom (1993 video game)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doom_(1993_video_game)]
* Internet Archive: "DOOM (Shareware Episode)":[https://archive.org/details/DoomsharewareEpisode]

title: karakuri_kengou_den_musashi_lord
body:
Musashi, the Samurai Lord, known in Japanese as Karakuri Kengō Den Musashi Lord (からくり剣豪伝ムサシロード, Karakuri Kengō Den Musashi Rōdo), is an anime series by Studio Pierrot. The 50-episode series aired on Nippon Television from October 1990 to September 1991.[3]

The series stars, [[Musashi (Karakuri Kengou den Musashi Lord)|]], a "gimmick robot". In the country of Zipangu every person has a gimmick robot. Musashi battles and meets his rival, Kojiro (a reference to the historical battle between Miyamoto Musashi and Sasaki Kojirō).

Two video games were released based on the anime.
other_names: からくり剣豪伝ムサシロード

title: ho-oh
body:
A Fire/Flying-type Legendary [[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]], #0250 in the National Pokédex.

A large, [[bird]]-like Pokémon with [[red eyes]]. It is [[orange_feathers|orange]] and [[white_feathers|white]] with a sun-like tail, [[green_feathers|green]]-tipped [[wings]], and curly forehead plumes. A [[rainbow]] is said to form behind it when it flies. The mascot of [[pokemon_gsc|Pokémon Gold]] and [[pokemon_hgss|HeartGold]]; its counterpart is [[Lugia]].

Japanese name: [b]Houou[/b]

h4. Official art
* !post #9411152

h4. See also:

* [[Ash Ketchum]]

title: lugia
body:
A Psychic/Flying-type Legendary [[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]], #0249 in the National Pokédex.

An aquatic, bird-like Pokémon with reptilian features. It has [[white skin]] and blocky [[wings]] which double as its hands. The mascot of [[pokemon_gsc|Pokémon Silver]] and [[pokemon_hgss|SoulSilver]]; its counterpart is [[Ho-Oh]].

Japanese name: [b]Lugia[/b]

body:
[[Princess Peach]] dressed as a [[farmer]], first appearing in [i][[Super Mario Odyssey]][/i] when her and [[Tiara (mario)|]] travel to the Luncheon Kingdom. Also appears in [i][[Mario Kart World]][/i]. 

She's dressed in [[pants rolled up|rolled up]] [[blue overalls]] with a [[pink shirt|pink]], [[long sleeves]] [[collared shirt]]. She also wears [[white gloves]], [[pink boots|pink]] [[rubber boots]] and a [[straw hat]].

title: assisted_masturbation
body:
When a character's creations or accessories, such as a [[doll]], danmaku, [[robot]], or magical creations sexually please their master, either by their own will, or while being controlled by their master.

Beings that are an aspect of one's self made manifest such as [[Konpaku Youmu (ghost)|Konpaku Youmu's ghost half]] or [[tatara_kogasa_(umbrella)|Tatara Kogasa's umbrella]] may apply as well.

title: char_aznable_(real)
body: [spoilers]The real person whose identity [[Char Aznable]] (aka "[[Casval Rem Deikun]]") stole, introduced in [[Mobile Suit Gundam THE ORIGIN]]. He is identical to Char, except for having [[brown eyes]]. Died before Casval/Char entered the [[Zeon]] [[military]] academy after being confused with Casval and getting himself killed in an explosion during an attempt on Casval's life by [[Kycilia Zabi]]'s men.[/spoilers]

title: lunick_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Lunick[/b] ([i]カヅキ[/i], Kazuki) is the male player character of [[Pokemon Ranger 1]]. If the player is a girl, he is a NPC ally.

His female counterpart is [[Solana (pokemon)|]].

title: hyper_novice_(ragnarok_online)
body:
The next job in the Super Novice class line in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Can equip nearly every weapon in the game, but commonly use [[holding sword|swords]] and [[holding dagger|daggers]].

Males wear a [[white shirt]] with [[puffy long sleeves]], a [[short necktie|short]] [[blue necktie]], a [[brown belt]], a [[pelvic curtain]], and [[blue pants]] [[pants tucked in|tucked into]] [[white boots|white]] [[fold-over boots]].

Females wear a [[blue capelet]] with a [[gold trim]], a [[white bowtie]], a [[white shirt]] with [[puffy long sleeves]] and [[buttons]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[blue skirt]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[brown boots|brown]] [[fold-over boots]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7312663
* !post #7312665

title: sakae_general_school_uniform
body:
A [[school uniform]] in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]].

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] with [[short over long sleeves]] and [[sleeve cuffs|cuffs]], a [[wing collar]], a [[red bowtie|red]] [[bowtie]], a [[brown skirt|brown]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[miniskirt]] with [[buttons]] and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]].

title: hinowa_(gintama)
body:
Hinowa (日輪), also known as The Sun of Yoshiwara (吉原の太陽), and Yoshiwara Paradise's (吉原桃源郷) is the highest ranking courtesan and de facto leader of Yoshiwara.

She has [[black hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears [[pink kimono]].

title: wallet_chain
body:
A short or long chain with clasps on both ends so that a wallet can be secured or fixed to a belt. As a motorcyclist, a wallet chain is an indispensable accessory.

Not to be confused with [[chain belt]], a chain used as a belt.

title: moe-chan_(moechannel)
body:
Mascot of [[MoeChannel]], the store of the artist [[onlinepetclub]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[pink dress]] with a [[white apron]], [[mismatched legwear]] (one [[purple thighhighs|purple thighhigh]] with a [[star print]], one [[white thighhighs|white thighhigh]] with a [[kaomoji]] print), a [[white hat]], [[white gloves|white]] [[paw gloves]] with [[pawpads]], and [[white shoes|white]] [[paw shoes]]. The front of her dress features a [[pink bow]] with an [[error message]] symbol.

Her outfit contains elements based on various 2000s anime-related characters, such as [[Mayura]], [[ME-tan]], and [[Nakahara Komugi]].

title: amatsuki_(crazy_raccoon)
body:
A male Japanese [[Amatsuki (utaite)|singer]], voice actor, [[virtual YouTuber]], and member of the Japanese esports organization [[Crazy Raccoon]]. 

h4. Appearance
* !post #5022297: Base form

He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. His default outfit consists of a [[white shirt]] worn over a [[black sweater|black]] [[turtleneck sweater]] and containing his artist logo (the letter "A" enclosed in a crescent moon), [[black pants]], [[white jacket]], [[white shoes]], [[orange belt]], and a gold [[necklace]]. 

h4. External links
* YouTube channels
** "Crazy Raccoon gaming account":[https://www.youtube.com/@amatsuki_YHch]
** "Official artist (utaite) account":[https://www.youtube.com/@amatsuki-official]

title: klavier_gavin
body:
[[Kristoph Gavin]]'s younger brother and [[Apollo Justice]]'s rival. Klavier is a prosecuting attorney who learned his trade at age 17 in Europe, and is interested in Apollo because [spoiler]he got his famous brother tried for murder.[/spoiler]

He has [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]], [[blue eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]] which is usually styled into a [[twisted hair|twist]] worn [[hair over shoulder|over his shoulder]].

He usually wears a [[single earring|single]] [[earrings|earring]] a [[chain necklace|chain]] [[necklace]] featuring his band's logo,, an [[open jacket|open]] [[purple jacket|purple]] [[jacket]] with [[long sleeves]] and [[lapels]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[shirt]] with an [[open collar|open]] [[popped collar|popped]] [[collared shirt|collar]] (that he wears in such a way that exposes a bit of his [[midriff peek|stomach]]), a set of [[multiple rings|rin]][[ring|gs]] on his fingers (including a [[thumb ring]]), a [[wallet chain]] and a [[chain belt|chain]] [[belt]], a pair of [[black pants|black]] [[pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[cross-laced footwear|cross-laced]] [[shoes]].

When he was seventeen, his hair was [[short hair|short]], and he wore [[sunglasses]], a black shirt with [[buttons]], a [[print shirt|print]] and [[sleeve cuffs]], a pair of black pants with [[pocket]]s and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[boots]].

[b]Japanese Name:[/b] Garyuu Kyouya

title: dragon_girl
body:
A female character with a dragon-like appearance.

For actual dragons, use the [[dragon]] tag instead (though there may or may not be overlap if [[personification]]/[[humanization]] is at play).

A particularly famous kind of dragon girl (or boy) is the [[Fire Emblem]] "manakete" or "mamkute" (マムクート); the games typically include at least one such character, often playable, who can transform from a human form into a full dragon, with the prominence of draconic features varying between each example. For ease of sorting, a separate "manakete" tag should not be made and all such characters should be sorted into the appropriate dragon-person tag.

h4. See also

* [[dragon boy]]
* [[dragon ears]]
* [[dragon horns]]
* [[dragon tail]]
* [[dragon wings]]

title: loader_4
body:
The players' default AC from the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]], piloted by the player character [[621 (armored core vi)|C4-621]].

LOADER 4 is a RaD scout AC using all XC-2000 series RaD produced parts and BAWS produced internal combustion generator. Default armaments include [[energy blade]], assault rifle and right side shoulder mounted [[missile pod]]. LOADER 4 is easily distinguished by its elongated head unit, the orange glow on its head unit also giving it an [[one-eyed]] appearance. LOADER 4 is painted primarily in gunmetal grey and black, with various glowing orange parts around the body.

title: mioda_ibuki
body:
A character from [[Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair]], titled the Ultimate Musician (超高校級の「軽音楽部」). A former member of Black Cherry, a popular girl group, Ibuki is currently pursuing a solo career. Despite her loud appearance, Ibuki is very upbeat and energetic, acting as a moodmaker for the rest of the students. She has a style that is a mix of [[punk]] and [[scene fashion]].

Ibuki has [[long hair|long]] [[multicolored hair]] ([[black hair|black]], [[blue hair|blue]], [[pink hair|pink]] and [[white hair|white]]) with formed [[hair horns]], [[pink eyes]] and [[mouth piercing|mouth]] [[piercing|piercings]]. She wears a [[serafuku]], [[mismatched legwear|differently colored]] [[torn thighhighs]] and a [[necklace]]. She has a [[stitches|stitched]] [[scar]] on her thigh (it’s actually a [[tattoo]]).

She was created by anonymous [[anonymous (japanese)|Futaba users]] in 2022 to represent the [[Kraken Regiment|]] during the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]]. She is the best friend of [[Marichka]].

title: ahiru_(duck)_(princess_tutu)
body:

Known as [b]Duck[/b] in English versions.

h4. Appearance

* !post #1316132

title: princess_tutu_(character)
body:
The titular character of [[Princess Tutu]] and alter ego of protagonist [[Ahiru (princess tutu)|]].

She has light skin, [[blue eyes]], and [[orange hair]] in a [[bob cut]], and wears a [[lily (flower)|]]-shaped [[mini crown|coronet]], a [[white feathers|white]] [[feather hair ornament|feathered]] [[headpiece]], a [[gold necklace]], a white [[tutu]], a [[gold bracelet|gold]] [[bead bracelet|beaded bracelet]] on each wrist, [[white pantyhose|white tights]], and pink [[ballet slippers|pointe shoes]].

Her costume is based on that of Odette, the main character of [i]Swan Lake[/i].

h4. Appearance

* !post #145662
* !post #148758
* !post #163631
* !post #8185980

h4. See also

* [[Ahiru (princess tutu)|]]
* [[Ahiru (Duck) (princess tutu)|]]

title: ahiru_(princess_tutu)
body:
The main protagonist of [[Princess Tutu]]. Known as [b]Duck[/b] in the English dub. A yellow [[ahiru (duck) (princess tutu)|duck]] who has been turned into a [[magical girl]], with the ability to transform into [[Princess Tutu (character)|]]. She turns back into a duck if her [[necklace]] is removed, and becomes human again if she gets wet.

title: chiester_sisters
body:
The Chiester Sisters are [[rabbit girl]] servants from the anime/visual novel [[Umineko no Naku Koro ni]].

They have [[red eyes]], [[rabbit ears]], and elaborate military-styled outfits. They are named after types of ammunition (00 buckshot, .45 Colt, .410 shotgun shell, and 5.56mm NATO).

* [[Chiester00]] - [[Blonde hair]] and [[eyepatch]].
* [[Chiester45]] - [[Pink hair]] and [[twintails]].
* [[Chiester410]] - [[Blue hair]].
* [[Chiester556]] - [[Purple Hair]].

This tag applies when a character is [[cosplay]]ing their distinct uniform in an [[alternate color]] or when [b]at least three[/b] of the original Chiester sisters are grouped together.

title: yoshi
body:
The [[dinosaur]]-like creatures appearing in the [[Mario_(series)|Mario]] series since [[Super Mario World]], as well as their own series of games. Has a [[frog]]-like tongue which can be used to swallow enemies and turn them into [[yoshi egg|eggs]] which can be thrown. They also all can rapidly kick their feet to gain more height mid-air, called a Flutter Jump. Voiced by composer Totaka Kazumi since [[Yoshi's Story]] in 1997.

They come in a multitude of colors, with green being the default. 

h6. Main Yoshi Colors
* [[Green Yoshi]]
* [[Red Yoshi]]
* [[Blue Yoshi]]
* [[Yellow Yoshi]]
* [[Pink Yoshi]]
* [[Light Blue Yoshi]]
* [[Purple Yoshi]]
* [[Brown Yoshi]]
* [[Black Yoshi]]
* [[White Yoshi]]
* [[Orange Yoshi]]

h6. Yoshi Exclusive Power-Ups
* [[Dash Yoshi]]
* [[Blimp Yoshi]]
* [[Bulb Yoshi]]

h6. Costumes
* [[Yoshi (Pirate Land)]]
* [[Yoshi (Reindeer)]]
* [[Yoshi (Egg Hunt)]]

Takashi Tezuka, director of Super Mario World and [[super_mario_world_2:_yoshi's_island|Yoshi's Island]], insists that Yoshis are not actually dinosaurs but more related to Turtles/[[Koopa_troopa|Koopas]].[tn]"[1]":[https://www.mariowiki.com/File:SMHAmerican_SMW_and_SMAS.jpg][/tn][tn]"[2]":[https://game.watch.impress.co.jp/docs/news/742615.html#:~:text=%E3%81%A7%E3%81%99%E3%81%8B%E3%82%89%E3%80%81%E6%9C%80%E5%88%9D%E3%81%AF%E6%81%90%E7%AB%9C%E3%81%A0%E3%81%A8%E6%80%9D%E3%81%A3%E3%81%A6%E3%81%9A%E3%81%A3%E3%81%A8%E7%B5%B5%E3%82%92%E6%8F%8F%E3%81%84%E3%81%A6%E3%81%84%E3%81%9F%E3%81%AE%E3%81%A7%E3%81%99%E3%81%8C%E3%80%81%E5%BE%8C%E3%81%AB%E3%81%AA%E3%81%A3%E3%81%A6%E6%9C%AC%E5%BD%93%E3%81%AF%E3%82%AF%E3%83%83%E3%83%91%E3%81%AA%E3%81%A9%E3%81%A8%E5%90%8C%E3%81%98%E3%82%AB%E3%83%A1%E4%B8%80%E6%97%8F%E3%81%AE%E3%82%AD%E3%83%A3%E3%83%A9%E3%82%AF%E3%82%BF%E3%83%BC%E3%81%A0%E3%81%A3%E3%81%9F%E3%81%A8%E8%81%9E%E3%81%8B%E3%81%95%E3%82%8C%E3%81%BE%E3%81%97%E3%81%9F%E3%80%82%E3%81%9D%E3%82%8C%E3%81%A7%E3%80%81%E3%81%A0%E3%82%93%E3%81%A0%E3%82%93%E6%99%82%E9%96%93%E3%81%8C%E7%B5%8C%E3%81%A4%E3%81%AB%E3%81%A4%E3%82%8C%E3%81%A6%E3%83%A8%E3%83%83%E3%82%B7%E3%83%BC%E3%81%AE%E3%83%87%E3%82%B6%E3%82%A4%E3%83%B3%E3%81%8C%E3%82%AB%E3%83%A1%E7%9A%84%E3%81%AA%E3%82%82%E3%81%AE%E3%81%AB%E8%BF%91%E4%BB%98%E3%81%84%E3%81%A6%E3%81%84%E3%81%A3%E3%81%9F%E3%82%93%E3%81%A7%E3%81%99%E3%82%88%E3%80%82%E3%81%BF%E3%81%AA%E3%81%95%E3%82%93%E3%81%8A%E6%B0%97%E4%BB%98%E3%81%8D%E3%81%A7%E3%81%97%E3%81%9F%E3%81%8B%EF%BC%9F][/tn][tn]"[3]":[https://www.nintendo.com/en-gb/News/2017/October/Nintendo-Classic-Mini-SNES-developer-interview-Volume-5-Super-Mario-World-and-Super-Mario-World-2-Yoshi-s-Island-1290850.html][/tn][tn]"[4]":[https://nintendoeverything.com/yoshis-crafted-world-devs-on-the-art-style-kindergarten-inspiration-flip-side-gimmick-more/][/tn]

title: astartes_(web_animation)
body: A fan-created [[Warhammer 40k]] animation, that was judged to be so exceptional that the animator was picked up by Games Workshop to make official material for them. The homemade [[Adeptus Astartes]] chapter featured in the series and the events of the series itself were canonized, and a second season was recently announced by Games Workshop.

title: matara_kan_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[Matara Kan]].

She wears a [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[fur-trimmed dress]] with a [[cleavage cutout|cleavage]] and [[stomach cutout]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and [[antenna hair|antenna]] when wearing this.

title: matara_kan_(military)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Matara Kan]].

Getting ready to battle the [[momo (matara kan)|Evil Momo]], she now wears a [[military uniform]] consisting of [[black hat|black]] [[peaked cap]] with a Momo emblem on the front, a [[white jacket]] and [[white pants]], a [[black gloves|black]] [[single gauntlet|gauntlet]] with a [[gold trim]] on her left hand, [[black footwear|matching]] [[thigh boots]] with [[pink footwear|pink highlights]] on the left boot, and a [[pink cape|pink]] [[fur trim]]med [[cape]] mimicking the shape of her wings.

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:

* [[very long hair|Very long]] [[pink hair]] done in a [[wolf cut]] with [[sidelocks]] and [[parted bangs]]
* [[Short hair]] with  [[short hair with long locks|locks reaching past her shoulders]]
* And she is able to go [[bald]]

body:

Dressing up for a day out, she now wears a long [[white coat|white]] [[fur-trimmed coat|fur-trimmed]] [[trench coat]] worn over a [[purple sweater]] and [[grey pants|grey]] [[skinny jeans]], as well as optional [[glasses]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has her [[long hair]] in a [[side ponytail]] which she can combine with her [[matara kan (1st costume)|default haircut]].

title: lenalee_lee
body:
A female character from the [[D.Gray-Man]] series. And the main heroine of the series. She is an Exorcist and the younger sister of [[Komui Lee]] and a close friend of other main characters, [[Allen Walker]], [[Kanda Yuu]] and [[Lavi]]. She is mostly depicted with long dark green hair which she wears in a pair of twintails and purple eyes and wears stud earrings and the [[Black Order Uniform]] along with a miniskirt. However, her appearance is subjected to change throughout the series, at some point her hair is shortened to a pixie cut. Before gradually growing and reaching the length to become a bob cut. Currently her hair is long enough to reach her shoulders and she likes to wear some of it in the form of the [[two side up]], reminiscing her old twintail hairstyle.

Lenalee's Innocence is an Equipment type called Dark Boots. Which manifest in the form of black thigh high boots initially. But after evolving, it manifests in the form of red anklets around her ankles. When activated, the Dark Boots allows her to fly in the air and land destructive kicks on her opponents.

title: techno_police_21c
body:
[b][i]Techno Police 21C[/i][/b] (テクノポリス21C [i]Tekunoporisu Nijūisseki[/i]) is a 1982 [[Japan]]ese [[science fiction]] [[cyberpunk]], [[mecha]] and [[police]] action anime film made by [[toho (movie company)|Toho Productions]] and produced by [[JVC]]. It was released in August 7, 1982.

Techno Police started in 1978 as an idea for a TV series from Artmic Studio founder Suzuki Toshimichi as a coproduction with Studio Nue. After 4 years in development the series was scrapped and the existing footage was compiled into an 80 minute movie and distributed by Toho.

Hisaishi Joe, who provides the synth-jazz score and is well known in the west for having created the soundtracks of several anime and live action films. Part of the animation and design staff were also [[Kawamori Shouji]] and [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] from Studio Nue, who are now famous for their mecha designs from [[MACROSS]]. Their work in Techno Police actually served them as preparation during the pre-production design phase of the first Macross series.

English dubbed versions of the film were released in VHS format during 1984 and 1987. Outside of the English speaking world unedited video versions of Techno Police 21C were seen in France, Germany and Spain, with even a theatrical run in Cuba.

In 1994/5 Techno Police was re-released by Best Film & Video Co on NTSC VHS to cash in on the popular rise in anime and Cyberpunk at the time with OVA's such as [[Bubblegum Crisis]], [[Appleseed]], [[Dangaiou]], [[Kidou Keisatsu Patlabor|Patlabor]], [[A.D. Police Files|AD Police]], [[Armitage III]] and Cyber City Oedo 808.

h4. See also

* [[Technoid]]s
* [[Scanny]]
* [[Blader]]
* [[Tom (Techno Police)]]
* [[Fubuki Eren]]

title: godzilla_(series)
body:
A [[tokusatsu]] media franchise created by [[toho (movie company)|Toho Films]] revolves around the titular [[kaiju]] [[Godzilla]], an anto-protagonist giant theropod-like kaiju who wreck havoc against humanity forces, yet protect the world from other kaiju and threats.

title: sonogami_rio
body:
She is a character exclusive to the game Date A Live Twin Edition: Rio Reincarnation and the novel version of the game.
Rio has long plum hair that reaches to her legs. She ties her hair with one single braid and has a bow at the top of her head. Her eyes have a deep color. While in her Astral Dress, Rio wears a lavish pinkish-red dress with a gold emblem on the center. The dress also contains a large robe that reaches her feet.

She's the daughter of [[Itsuka Shido|Shido]] and [[Sonogami Rinne|Rinne Sonogami]].
She's the niece of [[Yatogami Tohka|Tohka]] and Ren and granddaughter of [[Takamiya Mio|Mio Takamiya]].

h4. External Links
* "Date A Live Wiki: Rio Sonogami":https://date-a-live.fandom.com/wiki/Rio_Sonogami

title: murasame_reine
body:
She is the character from [[Date a Live]] series. 
She is the Head Analyst aboard Fraxinus and a non-certified medic who can perform simple first aid tasks.
Reine is a highly intelligent and rational woman. She is the Analysis Officer of the Fraxinus’s crew and the assistant homeroom teacher of [[Itsuka Shido]]'s classroom. She is also the only member that could be considered "normal" among the Fraxinus's weird crew. Reine also acts as an unofficial aide to [[Itsuka Kotori]], the commander of Fraxinus, due to the fact that the vice-commander acts like an idiot most of the time or is ignored by Kotori for being an idiot.

Beautiful and intelligent, her only flaw is being sleep deprived, since she doesn't seem to sleep much. Reine transfers into Shido’s school, Raizen High School as the school's new physics teacher when Shido joined Ratatoskr. Reine usually gives the best advice or opinions out of Ratatoskr's crew during both the Fraxinus crew's operations to seal Spirits and normal circumstances.

[spoiler]It is revealed in light novel that she is the enigmatic entity known as Phantom, and later the doppleganger of Spirit of Origin [[Takamiya Mio]].[/spoiler]

h4. External Links
* "Date A Live Wiki: Reine Murasame":https://date-a-live.fandom.com/wiki/Reine_Murasame

title: okamine_tamae
body: [[Itsuka Shido|Shidou's]] class's teacher in [[Date A Live]]. Also known as Tama-chan-sensei.

title: takamiya_shinji
body:
He's the character from [[Date a Live]] series. 
He has a younger sister named [[Takamiya Mana]].
He has the looks of a handsome young man in high school. He has straight blue hair and bands down to his neck and amber brown eyes.

[spoiler]It was later revealed that he met with the Spirit of Origin and named her [[Takamiya Mio]].[/spoiler]

h4. See also
* [[Itsuka Shido]] for more details.

title: sonogami_rinne
body:
She is a character exclusive to the game [[Date a Live: Rinne Utopia]] and the novel version of the game.
Rinne has short, light pink hair, with part of her hair tied up in a braid. She has light brown eyes and is seen wearing a uniform with a sweater that has the logo of Raizen High School.

In her Spirit form, Rinne's hair length increases to the point where her braids reach a length approaching her legs. Her eyes turn into a more intense pink, almost red color. Her Astral Dress takes on the appearance of a purple clock with golden extensions on her shoulders and hips. The vast majority of her face is covered by a veil. At the top of her head, there is a decorated headdress with a golden emblem at the center.

She has a daughter with [[Itsuka Shido|Shido]] and is [[Sonogami Rio|Rio Sonogami]].
She's the younger sister of [[Yatogami Tohka|Tohka]] and Ren and daughter of [[Takamiya Mio|Mio Takamiya]].

h4. External Links
* "Date A Live Wiki: Rinne Sonogami":https://date-a-live.fandom.com/wiki/Rinne_Sonogami

title: kyouno_natsumi
body:
The seventh Spirit appeared in [[Date A Live]].

Her ability is transformation, which allowed her to transform into her adult version in the first appearance. Her real form is a little girl with unkempt hair and clothing. She appeared antagonistic in the first initial appearance because she thought [[Itsuka Shido]] had seen her "ugly" form.

Voiced by [[Mano Ayumi]].

title: itsuka_shiori
body:
A character from [[Date a Live]]. The alter ego of [[Itsuka Shido]] to try to conquer [[Izayoi Miku]]. 

[spoiler]Later in the novel, it is revealed that Shidou can change his gender with the powers of [[Kyouno Natsumi]].[/spoiler]

title: itsuka_kotori
body: [[itsuka shido|Shido]]’s adoptive sister in [[Date A Live]]. Voiced by [[Taketatsu Ayana]] in Japanese.

title: yatogami_tohka
body:
She is one of the main female characters of the [[Date A Live]] series and the first Spirit saved by [[Itsuka Shido]].

Tohka is a girl with very long, dark-purple hair in the same shade as the color of the night. She partially tied back into a ponytail with a ribbon while still letting much of her hair fall to her knees. Her dark purple eyes are described as crystal-like and have a golden tint. Shido remarks that her beauty is to to the extent of almost being violent.

Upon her arrival on Earth, Tohka wore an Astral Dress with a black, cream, and pink color scheme and a set of purple-and-cream plated armor which adorned her shoulders and waist. The dress is open at the back and made up into a black corset (which exposes a part of her cleavage) and a two-layered, knee-length skirt which has a pink-to-white gradient. Her hair is tied back using a butterfly-shaped hair accessory. She also wears a pair of gauntlets which have petal-like cuffs, both sharing the same color scheme as her attire, as well as a pair of armored boots. While using Halvanhelev, her ribbon grows longer and sharper, and her underlying dress of light becomes more ragged.

Upon her admission to Raizen High School, Tohka adopts the female uniform of said school. This apparel consists of a black, long-sleeved top (winter version), or a white, short-sleeved top (summer version), together with a blue skirt, and a pair of long, black stockings that reach up to half of her thigh.

[spoiler]She is an alternate personality of [[Yatogami Tenka]]  created by [[Takamiya Mio]].[/spoiler]

h4. External Links
* "Date A Live Wiki: Tohka Yatogami":https://date-a-live.fandom.com/wiki/Tohka_Yatogami

title: takamiya_mana
body:
She is a character from [[Date a Live]] series, and is [[Itsuka Shido]]'s biological little sister. She is a temporary Second Lieutenant of the AST, and she used to work for the DEM Industries base in England as a Wizard.

Mana appears to be around the age of a middle-school girl. She has long blue hair, tied up in a ponytail, with some bangs left out. She has brown eyes and a mole under her left eye. She resembles Shido a lot, as stated by Tohka.

When she is at the JGSDF base, she wears a military uniform. Due to her young age, however, it gives others the impression that she's cosplaying.

During combat, she wears a light blue CR-Unit. After joining Ratatoskr, she wears a black and blue CR-Unit vaguely resembling a wolf's fangs and claws.

h4. External Links
* "Date A Live Wiki: Mana Takamiya":https://date-a-live.fandom.com/wiki/Mana_Takamiya

title: itsuka_shido
body:
The protagonist of the [[Date a Live]] story. He possesses a strange power that allows him to seal the powers of a Spirit in his body with a kiss.

During the events of Miku Lily, Shido had to crossdress as a girl to interact with Miku, thereby disguising himself as his alternate identity, [[Itsuka Shiori]].

[spoiler]It is later revealed that Shido was originally [[Takamiya Shinji]].[/spoiler]

h4. See also

* [[Itsuka Shiori]] (his alter ego)
* [spoiler][[Takamiya Shinji]] (his original form)[/spoiler]

h4. External links

* "Date A Live Wiki: Shido Itsuka":https://date-a-live.fandom.com/wiki/Shido_Itsuka

title: panicking
body: When a character is shown to be in a state of visible panic. This can either be done for comedic purposes in which its overdone or in a dramatic situation.

title: caution_tape
body:
Various colored tape that can carry words like "[[Keep out]]" or "Crime scene: Do not enter". Usually the tape has a yellow background with black text, but other variants do exist like orange/black or in the case of police caution tape, white background with blue or black text with or without a checkered square pattern.

May or may not be adhesive. Most caution tape are designed to be strung between two or more points.

title: keep_out
body: Any presence of the words "keep out". Often associated with [[caution tape]]s, but can also be seen elsewhere such as on the sign in post #5825577.

body:

title: wanted_poster
body:
A poster distributed by [[police]] to warn the public about a criminal who is wanted for arrest. A wanted poster usually has the word "WANTED" at the top, and the fugitive's name and picture on the bottom. Sometimes a bounty or a list of their crimes is included.

In earlier times (or fictional settings), wanted posters would sometimes also read "wanted dead or alive", making the wanted criminal an outlaw in the literal sense (i.e. a person from whom the protection of the law was withdrawn and who could be killed without official repercussions by anyone).

h4. See also

* [[mugshot]]
* [[poster (object)]]
* [[poster (medium)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Wanted poster":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wanted_poster]

title: blowing
body:
The act of forcefully exhaling air out of the mouth. Can be done for a multitude of reasons, including but not limited to:

* Cooling hot foods or beverages
* Extinguishing [[candle|candles]]
* Dispersing [[dust]], [[dandelion_seed|dandelion seeds]], etc.
* [[blowing bubbles|Blowing bubbles]], [[snow]] or spinning [[pinwheel|pinwheels]]
* Playing wind [[instrument|instruments]]
* Inflating [[beachball|beach balls]] or other toys
* Stimulating [[penis]]

Characters blowing may be depicted with [[puffy cheeks]], [[pursed lips]], and possibly a [[>_<]] expression.

h4.See also
* [[puff of air]]
* [[breath]]
* [[breathing fire]]
* [[breathing on hands]]

title: peanut_mouth
body:
When a mouth is open wider at the sides than at the middle.

It can convey variety of emotions, though typically it is used for the general feeling of unease, such as being [[embarrassed]], [[surprised]], or [[scared]], etc.

If the mouth is closed, use [[wavy mouth]] instead.

h4. Example
* !post #8597165

h4. See Also

* [[open mouth]]
* [[parted lips]]
* [[wavy mouth]]

title: leafmat_(arknights)
body:
An elite enemy in the Vector Breakthrough game mode of [[Arknights]].
An orphan brought to Rhodes Island by [[Sharp_(Arknights)|Sharp]]. Has such high speed that when going all out, even Sharp had difficulty keeping up, leading to their recognition and recruitment into Sharp's team. Feels frustrated with how Sharp often acts alone.

title: judica_(rozen_maiden)
body:
Judica and [[Madulin (Rozen Maiden)|]] are fake [[Rozen Maiden]] twin dolls, possibly to be a counterfeit version of [[Suiseiseki]] and [[Souseiseki]]. They were both made by Kaito Toriumi. They have long, white, wavy hair and one eye sewn shut (Judica's right, Madulin's left). Most of their front torsos are exposed, revealing their insides that appear filled with gears that spin when they are together. They are held together by many belts around their waists, these belts break apart when they separate. Both wear a ragged white dress, white wrappings around their legs, detached sleeves, a choker with a ribbon tied up under the face, and a small white hat with roses on it. 

https://rozenmaiden.fandom.com/wiki/Judica_and_Madulin

title: parappa_the_rapper
body:
A video game series for the PlayStation. Received an anime in 2001 with the opening done by [[Nona Reeves]].

In the game, you play as PaRappa, a paper thin dog, and you follow a rap rhythm by pressing buttons when instructed to do so.

title: esrb
body:
The [b]Entertainment Software Rating Board[/b] (ESRB) is an American organization that assigns age and content ratings to video games. It was formed in 1994 in response to criticism of games featuring violent or sexual content.

This tag refers to the [[content rating]] logos themselves (including parody ones ala post #9402061). The ratings are as follows:

* [b]EC[/b]: Early Childhood. For games aimed towards younger children.
* [b]E[/b]: Everyone. For games suitable for all ages. Formerly Kids to Adults (K-A) until 1998.
* [b]E10+[/b]: Everyone 10+. For games suitable for those aged 10 or older.
* [b]T[/b]: Teen. For games suitable for those aged 13 or older.
* [b]M[/b]: Mature. For games suitable for those aged 17 or older.
* [b]AO[/b]: Adults Only. For games suitable for those aged 18 or older. A very rare rating, it is mostly applied to adult video games and is not allowed to be sold in stores or on consoles.

h4. See also
* [[CERO]] (Computer Entertainment Rating Organization) for the Japanese rating system.
* [[PEGI]] (Pan-European Game Information) for the European rating system.

h4. External links

* "Official site":[https://www.esrb.org/]
* "Wikipedia: Entertainment Software Rating Board":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entertainment_Software_Rating_Board]

title: orga
body:
Orga is an artist tag associated with mostly Ghibli uploads to Danbooru from April to November of 2007 by ShinjiDude

It's unclear which account (Pixiv or otherwise) this artist alias may have been associated with.

Later artists would also come to use the name, generating subsequent confusion:

[[organ derwald]]
[[orga_(orgacl)]]
[[yomoyama874]]

Eventually a longer name (perhaps a parenthesis for emphasis) could be useful here, as well as any external sites the artist may have used in the early 2000s.

title: scalpel
body:
A small and extremely sharp [[knife]] used for surgery, anatomical dissection, and various arts and crafts (called a hobby knife). Double-edged scalpels are referred to as "lancets".

This tag is specifically for the medical tool. If the image is showing the the blade being used in an arts-and-crafts context, use [[hobby knife]] instead.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Scalpel":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scalpel]

body:
A [[virtual Youtuber]] unit created by (but not owned or managed by) Ichikara as a rival to [[Animare]]. Like Animare, they were created as both members of upd8 and [[Nanashi Inc.]] before leaving upd8 on April 30, 2020. They were later entirely integrated into Nanashi Inc. on March 21, 2023 alongside the other groups.

They are a group of beautiful demons who run a night cafe. [[Sugar Lyric]] is their sister unit.

title: gm_sniper_ii
body:
A fictional giant manned robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]RGM-79SP GM Sniper II[/b]

The ultimate [[GM_(mobile_suit)|]] [[mobile suit]] variant of [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]] in [[Gundam 0080]]. It had augmented sensors, reinforced Luna Titanium armor in select places, greatly improved thrust and mobility precision, and an incredibly varied array of weapons including machine guns, beam rifles, beam guns, bazookas, and a powerful bullet firing sniper rifle which only the GM Sniper II was capable of accurately using. 

It was one of the few Federation units that could take the fight to Zeon's mighty [[Gelgoog]] and even challenge the monstrous [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] in terms of raw unit performance, if used properly.

h4. See also
* [[GM Sniper]]
* [[GM Sniper Custom]]
* [[GM Sniper III]]
* [[nemo_(mobile_suit)|Nemo]]

title: gundam_tank
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] / [[tank]] hybrid from the [[Gundam]] mechaverse. Infamously appeared in [[Gundam 0079 The War for Earth]].

After having its lower body (B Part) damaged in a mission and not being repaired by the time it needed to deploy again, the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]] is forced to attach to the B Part of the [[Guntank]], resulting in the Gundam launching out with [[caterpillar tracks]] instead. This is possible due to the Core Block system the two mecha share, the same system which allows the Gundam to combine with the [[G-Fighter]].

Due to War for Earth being blacklisted by Bandai unlike even [[Gundam G-SAVIOUR|G-SAVIOUR]], aside from an appearance in a [[Gundam Gihren no Yabou|Gihren no Yabou]] 4koma anthology, a cameo appearance in the "second episode":[http://stonedustghost.tumblr.com/post/63460385509] of [[Gundam Build Fighters]], and being makeable in [[Gundam Breaker]], the Gundam Tank has not made many appearances since.

h4. See also

* [[Zaku Tank]]

title: score
body:
A tally system that counts points in numbers. It can be used to decide the winner of a competition (games, sports, etc.) or a single counter that decides the final result one got in something (exams, single-player game, etc.).

Applicable to both real life and video game examples. The numbers must be clearly seen to represent points the player(s) achieve during a play, and it's still ongoing.

See [[musical staff]] or [[sheet music]] for music scores.

h4. See also

* [[ranking]] - The final result of a score, can be represented with numbers or letters.
* [[scorecard]] - Cards used by judges to evaluate the performance of competitors

title: scorecard
body:
A typically circular or rectangular card originally held up by judges to evaluate competitors in an athletic or performance setting. Usage has since evolved to cover anything from general actions to appearance, with higher values representing approval and vice versa. 

Scorecards exist in both basic card and handheld sign versions, with the most common score ranges being 0–10 and 0–100.

h4. Examples
* !post #8012380
* !post #3603597
* !post #9372344

h4. See also
* [[score]]

title: warhammer_40k
body:
[quote][i]In the grim darkness of the far future, there is only war.[/i] - promotional slogan[/quote]

A tabletop miniature wargame produced by Games Workshop since 1987, set in a bleak, war-torn [[science fiction]] and  [[fantasy]] universe. The setting has spawned numerous novels, games and movie adaptations.

Its tagline became the namesake for the grimdark genre of works of fiction as bleakly dystopian as WH40K or sometimes even more so. 

h4. Races/Factions

h6. [[Imperium of Man]]

* [[Adeptus Astartes]] (Space Marines)

* [[Adeptus Custodes]]

h6. Xenos

title: hawk_tuah_(meme)
body:
[b]Hawk Tuah[/b] is a 2024 viral meme that gain popularity where Haliey Welch, made a sound of spitting on another's man penis after being interviewed and asked what men find sexy.

As a result of the popularity of the meme, Welch became famous which led to her having her own podcast, Talk Tuah. However, she has since disappeared from the public after being accused of scamming her followers into investing in a cryptocurrency meme coin.

title: electric_hearts
body:
[b]Electric Hearts[/b] is a science fiction project created by [[Tyson Tan]].

Follow [[Alice Rosetta]], the first robot with true artificial intelligence. Witness her growth in today’s world and her adventures in the future.

* Cute and approachable mech designs
* Detailed and reality-based world building
* Everyday life-focused stories and plots

Electric Hearts is set in the same universe as [[Spirit Animals in Disguise]].

During development the project was previously known as inter.Natal, Oasis, Xing, SYNC, and A3.

title: zoolander
body: Zoolander is a 2001 American comedy film directed by and starring [[Ben Stiller]]. A satire on the fashion industry, the film follows fashion model Derek Zoolander (Stiller) who is tricked by fashion mogul Jacobim Mugatu (Will Ferrell) to assassinate the Prime Minister of Malaysia, whose progressive laws on the fashion industry would harm his businesses. The film received generally positive reviews and was both a critical and box-office success. A sequel, Zoolander 2, was released in February 2016. An animated film, Zoolander: Super Model, was released on Netflix UK in August 2016.

title: possessed
body:
When a character's body is being controlled by other entity that took over their mind, either a [[ghost]], [[parasite]], [[eldritch abomination]] etc..

This is different from [[mind control]] in that possession featuring another person or entity is inhabiting their body and using it as their own, while mind control there they are being forced to do something by an external force that has taken over their mind ([[hypnosis]] or similar). This is usually indicated by a [[different reflection]] in a mirror, their eye color changing, or some other part of their appearance.

h4. See also
* [[Body switch]]

body:
A [[spoon]] that is smaller than an average utensil, used for eating small portions of [[ice cream]]. They are usually [[disposable spoon|disposable]], made from [[wooden spoon|wood]] or [[plastic spoon|plastic]] and may have a flat bowl.

The tag can also be used for those non-disposable, long-handle with a small bowl usually used to eat [[parfait]] or [[sundae]].

title: bowlegged_pose
body:
A pose in which the person squats slightly with knees pointed outward, contracting the [[ass|glutes]] to emphasize the [[crotch]] by pushing it forward. Often accompanied by [[arms behind head]] and [[leaning back]]. In general, posts with this tag should contain characters who are [[standing]] in a partial squat position. This does not include a full [[squatting|squat]] (hip joint below the knees) or [[kneeling]]. If the character is [[sitting]] or [[lying]] down, consider using [[spread legs]] instead.

Not to be confused with [[pigeon-toed]]. 

h4. Examples

* !post #6423062
* !post #6097247

title: spirit_animals_in_disguise
body:
[b]Spirit Animals in Disguise[/b] is a fantasy project created by [[Tyson Tan]].

Follow the perspective of [[Leiting the Spirit Loong|Ao Leiting]], a human girl who accidentally becomes a spirit loong. Discover how spirit animals live among humans in disguise, and how the kids uncover the historic roots of traditional folklore.

* Spirit animals in human, anthro, and animal forms
* Limited abilities and rich world building
* Everyday life-focused stories and plots

[b]Note: [/b]Spirit Animals in Disguise is set in the same universe as [[Electric Hearts]].

title: libbie_the_spirit_oryx
body:
Libbie was the originally a mascot designed by [[Tyson Tan]] for LibreOffice's mascot contest. She was rejected under dubious circumstances.

Tyson Tan now repurposed her as a character in his personal project [[Spirit Animals in Disguise]].

title: tenkajin_chiyari
body: Tainted Organic Monster First appeared in [[Touhou]] 19: [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]] as a boss and playable character. Chiyari is a Tenkajin who is often confused for a chupacabra. She has [[wavy_hair|wavy]], [[purple hair]] with a [[single horn]] on her head. She wears a [[t-shirt]] with the words "Welcome to Hell" or "I ♥ LOVE (OLD) HELL" or "やっぱ旧だよね！" (It's gotta be Old (Hell)!) written on it, and carries [[test tube|test tubes]] and [[syringe|syringes]] on her [[shorts]]. In her defeated sprite it shows that she's actually really skinny underneath her big and baggy shirt. Chiyari is a shut-in who lives in the Former Hell of Blood Pools and is acquainted with characters like [[Kaenbyou Rin]] and [[Reiuji Utsuho]]. She works with the Gouyoku Alliance as part of their operations to take over the surface world. In reality, as with [[Son Biten]] and [[Mitsugashira Enoko]], she is a spy whose true allegiance lies with [[Nippaku Zanmu]]. She was tasked with sabotaging the Gouyoku Alliance's invasion plans from within by playing them for time as part of Zanmu's gambit to prevent a surface war. Unlike with Saki or Yachie, Yuuma never trusted her, but still keeps Chiyari around as a future asset against Zanmu. h4. Appearance * !post #6586894 h4. External Links * "Touhou Wiki: Tenkajin Chiyari":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Chiyari_Tenkajin

title: toutetsu_yuuma
body: [b] Undefeated Matriarch of the Gouyoku Alliance [/b] Toutetsu Yuuma is the main antagonist and final boss of [[Touhou]] 17.5, [[sunken fossil world|Gouyoku Ibun ~ Suibotsushita Chinshuu Jigoku (Strange Tale of Avarice ~ Submerged Hell of Sunken Sorrow)]], first mentioned in Wily Beast and Weakest Creature. In [[Unfinished Dream of All Living Ghost]], she is revealed to have once been friends with [[Yakumo Ran|Ran]]. As her title suggests, she's the boss of the [[Eagle Spirit (touhou)|]]s. She has large [[red horns|red]], [[sheep horns]], with a [[horn ribbon]] on both horns. She has [[curly hair|curly]], [[white hair]], [[red eyes]] with [[horizontal pupils|horizontal]], [[rectangular pupils]], and is often depicted with [[sharp teeth]]. She wears [[hoop earrings]] on her [[pointy ears]]. She wears a [[blue dress]] with [[detached_sleeves|detached]], [[red sleeves]]. Her clothing has a [[meandros]] [[patterned clothing|pattern]] with [[eye print]]s. Some artists may depict her wearing a [[blue vest]] and [[blue skirt]] instead. She often goes [[barefoot]] and [[holding spork|carries around]] an [[oversized object|oversized]] [[spork]] which may be filled with [[motor oil]] or [[blood]]. Her spork may be depicted as a [[spoon]] by some artists, either deliberately or as a mistake. Her ability allows her to devour and absorb almost absolutely anything, turning it into her power. Unlike her fellow Animal Realm matriarchs, she and her organization prefer to avoid pointless conflict, and would rather recruit or forge a mutually-beneficial relationship with their enemies, with an all-out war being a last resort for them. Taking advantage of the events in Wily Beast and Weakest Creature, she went to the Former Hell of Blood Pools in order to monopolize the petroleum deposits there, containing the desires of long dead organic beings. Note: If you can't concretely identify the utensil she is wielding (even with the tags/title/commentary/parent-child posts/pools), just tag [[utensil]] instead. h4. Appearance * !post #6516433 h4. See also * [[Imaginary Toutetsu]] h4. External links * "Touhou Wiki: Yuuma Toutetsu":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Yuuma_Toutetsu

title: grand_moff_tarkin
body:
A character from the [[Star Wars]] franchise and the main antagonist of the first film, [[Star Wars: A New Hope|A New Hope]].

[b]Wilhuff Tarkin[/b], also known as [b]Grand Moff Tarkin[/b], was a thin, middle-aged Human male who was one of the most powerful officers in the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]], a Grand Moff who shaped Imperial doctrine and was the driving force behind the creation of its key embodiment, the gargantuan [[planet]]-destroying superweapon, the [[Death Star]], as well as its commander. Tarkin is portrayed by Peter Cushing in Star Wars.

Tarkin also appears in the films [[star wars: revenge of the sith|Revenge of the Sith]] and [[Rogue One: a Star Wars Story|Rogue One]], and in the animated series The Clone Wars, Rebels, and The Bad Batch. He is featured in the 2014 novel Tarkin, which details his backstory and his rise to power within the Empire. In 2006, the entertainment website IGN called Tarkin "one of the most formidable villains" in Star Wars history.

title: barbie_(live_action)
body:
A 2023 live action film adaptation of the [[Barbie (franchise)|]] toy line, starring [[Margot Robbie]] as [[Barbie (character)|]] and [[Ryan Gosling]] as [[Ken (barbie)|]]. Became the highest-grossing movie of [[2023]] and the highest-grossing live-action comedy film of all time, smashing the domestic record formerly held by [[Home Alone]] (1990) and the worldwide record formerly held by [[The Hangover|The Hangover Part II]] (2011) simultaneously.

body:
[[Yuruyuri]]

[[Ikeda Chitose]]'s twin sister, who looks identical to her except for eye colour, but has a completely different personality. Similar to Chitose, she takes off her glasses and has [[yuri]] fantasies pairing Chitose with [[Sugiura Ayano]], albeit she drools instead of having nosebleeds. She has a love for Chitose while she dislikes [[Toshinou Kyouko]] as Kyouko constantly tries to play pranks on her and is seemingly a barrier against her fantasies.

title: akaza_akari
body:
Sometimes nicknamed [I][[akkari~n|Akarin]][/I], Akari is supposedly the main protagonist of [[Yuruyuri]]. However, as she is an ordinary person and often pales in comparison to the other characters, she is often bantered with her small presence and pushed into the background. Her friends often peg her character as having the ability to turn invisible and fire her '[[double bun|hair buns]]' like missiles. 

[[Toshinou Kyouko]] and [[Funami Yui]] are her childhood friends, while [[Yoshikawa Chinatsu]], [[Oomuro Sakurako]] and [[Furutani Himawari]] are some of her classmates.

Akari has an older sister named [[Akaza Akane]].

title: oomuro_nadeshiko
body:
Character in [[Yuruyuri]] and [[Oomuro-ke]]. Currently attending college.

She is the older sister of [[Oomuro Sakurako]] and [[Oomuro Hanako]].

It is implied that either [[miwa ai|Ai]], [[sonokawa megumi|Megumi]], or [[yaeno miho|Miho]] could be her girlfriend.

title: oomuro_sakurako
body:
Character in [[Yuruyuri]] and [[Oomuro-ke]]. A cheerful candidate for next year's student council vice-president.

She is the older sister of [[Oomuro Hanako]] and younger sister of [[Oomuro Nadeshiko]].

She has [[blonde hair]], [[small breasts]] and is often jealous of [[Furutani Himawari]]'s larger breasts. She and Himawari are constantly arguing due to their competition that dates back to their childhood, though they do seem to hold feelings for each other. [[Akaza Akari]] and [[Yoshikawa Chinatsu]] are also classmates of hers.

title: toshinou_kyouko
body:
The substantial main protagonist of [[Yuruyuri]]. The main protagonist is originally supposed to be [[Akaza Akari]], but Akari's presence is noticed less and less as more characters are introduced.

Kyouko is often causing [[Funami Yui]] bother and crushing on [[Yoshikawa Chinatsu]]. Despite her lazy attitude, she often gets high scores in tests after cram sessions and is also a talented doujin artist. She loves [[rum raisin]] ice cream and a magical girl character known as [[Mirakurun]]. Yui and Akari are her childhood friends. Occasionally cosplay as [[Rivalun]].

title: furutani_himawari
body:
Character in [[Yuruyuri]] and [[Oomuro-ke]]. Another candidate for next year's student council vice-president.

She is the older sister of [[Furutani Kaede]].

She has [[blue hair]], [[large breasts]] and always speaks in feminine and polite speech. Her large breasts often bring out jealousy from [[Oomuro Sakurako]]. She and Sakurako have been arguing and competing against each other dating back to their childhood, though they do seem to hold feelings for each other. [[Yoshikawa Chinatsu]] and [[Akaza Akari]] are also classmates of hers.

title: nanamori_school_uniform
body:
A [[serafuku]]-style school uniform worn by the students of (fictional) Nanamori Middle School in [[Yuruyuri]]. The uniform consists of a [[white shirt]] (brown at the [[brown sailor collar|collar]], shoulder and along the edge of the shirt) with a single-[[buttons|button]] on the front at the chest, and a [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[red dress|burgundy (dark red) dress]] underneath. Students typically wear black legwear to go along with the uniforms.

Example: post #2596755

h4.See also

* [[List of Uniforms]]

title: oomuro_hanako
body:

She is the younger sister of [[Oomuro Sakurako]] and [[Oomuro Nadeshiko]].

title: ikeda_chitose
body:
A [[Yuruyuri]] character. As a member of student council, she is almost always seen with [[Sugiura Ayano]]. Though Chitose has a gentle disposition, whenever she takes her [[glasses]] off she has various [[yuri]] fantasies and almost always pairs [[Toshinou Kyouko]] together with [[Sugiura Ayano]] in those fantasies, which often lead to near-fatal nosebleeds. She speaks in soft Kansai dialect and likes pickles.

Chitose has [[blue eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] and wears ([[rimless eyewear|rimless]]) [[round eyewear|round glasses]].

title: funami_yui
body: The cool-headed voice of reason in [[Yuruyuri]]. She is a reliable and mature person who usually lives alone in an apartment complex, but actually feels lonely without anyone else around. Although generally quiet, she will sometimes burst into laughter upon hearing [[Sugiura Ayano]]'s puns. She is sometimes stressed by one of her childhood friends [[Toshinou Kyouko]]. [[Akaza Akari]] is also a childhood friend of her's.

title: matsumoto_rise
body:
The current student council president in [[Yuruyuri]]. She has very little presence and often speaks in a whispery quiet voice that only a few people such as [[Nishigaki Nana]] can understand.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[red eyes]].

title: yoshikawa_chinatsu
body:
[[Yuruyuri]]

A pink-haired girl in [[Akaza Akari]]'s class who originally wanted to join the school's Tea Ceremony club, but ended up joining the Amusement club because the Tea Ceremony club was abolished. She is often chased after by [[Toshinou Kyouko]] due to her resemblance to [[Mirakurun]], though she herself has a passionate crush on [[Funami Yui]]. She acts cute, especially in the presence of Yui, but she sometimes shows dark thoughts and terrifying artistic skills.

She has an older sister named [[Yoshikawa Tomoko]].

title: sugiura_ayano
body: The [[tsundere]] student council vice-president in [[Yuruyuri]]. She is often not too honest with her feelings for [[Toshinou Kyouko]] and always refers to Kyouko by her full name. As a dedicated student, she constantly sees herself as a rival to Kyouko, who always manages to beat Ayano in test scores. Ayano often makes puns on place names, causing a normally quiet [[Funami Yui]] to burst into laughter.

title: tomato_costume
body:
A costume that makes the wearer look like an anthropomorphic tomato. Typically red and has a hood with a green "stem" on top.
Most commonly seen worn by [[Toshinou Kyouko]] from [[Yuruyuri]]; the pixiv tag used for it (トメィトゥ, "tomeitou") is based on the way she pronounces the word in the manga. (The vegetable's name is normally トマト in Japanese, pronounced "tomahtoh".)

title: news_van
body:
A type of [[van]] used by broadcast industry. They are designed to be a mobile studio and production facility, allowing for live broadcasts, recording, and editing of video content on any location. 

News vans can be identified by a [[satellite dish]] on top of them or a broadcaster logo.

title: ushi_gozen_(fate)
body:
A younger version of [[Minamoto no Raikou (fate)|]] from her days when she was fully living as an [[oni]]. Ushi Gozen first appeared as a Berserker-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Tenma Otogizoushi Onigashima]] event appearing identical to Minamoto no Raikou's [[Minamoto no Raikou (Third Ascension) (fate)|third ascension]]. She later appeared as the Rider-class servant of [[Yui Shousetsu (fate)|]] in [[Fate/Samurai Remnant]], and was introduced into Fate/Grand Order as the Avenger-class servant [b]Minamoto no Raikou/Ushi Gozen[/b] in the [[Eigetsu Kenbuu Chou]] event.

title: campaign_hat
body:
A campaign hat (also campaign cover, drill instructor cover, drill sergeant hat, lemon squeezer, Montana Peak, Mountie hat, ranger hat, sergeant hat, Scouts hat and Smokey Bear) is a broad-brimmed felt or straw hat, with a high crown, pinched symmetrically at the four corners (the "Montana crease").


It is associated with the [[New Zealand]] Army, the [[Royal Canadian Mounted Police]], the [[World War I]] ground forces of the [[United States Army]], contemporary U.S. military [[drill instructor|drill instructors]], US state police forces, park rangers (and from them, their logo-cartoon and mascot Smokey Bear), Boy Scouts, and others.


Although the campaign hat is occasionally referred to as a Stetson, this is from its common manufacture in the late 19th century by that company. It should not be confused with the quite different Stetson hat type with a different brim and crease, commonly known as the cowboy hat, and which is more commonly meant by the term "Stetson" today. The campaign hat also should not be confused with a slouch hat.


Several U.S. state police services (for example, the Utah Highway Patrol), and federal agencies (for example, the United States Border Patrol) wear campaign hats. These state troopers are responsible for state and interstate highway safety, and in this capacity are variously referred to in different states as State Police, Highway Patrol, State Patrol, and State Highway Patrol. So common is use of the campaign hat among state highway police that they are sometimes referred to as "smokey bears" or "smokeys," after Smokey Bear the famous logo-character of the U.S. Forest Service. The only State Police agencies that do not employ the “smokey bear hat”, are the New York State Police, Connecticut State Police, New Jersey State Police, Texas Highway Patrol, Maryland State Police, New Mexico State Police, and the Michigan State Police. There is no direct association between the cartoon bear and the Highway Patrol; they both derive their hat styles ultimately from the U.S. Cavalry.

Many other [[police]] agencies, including numerous county [[sheriff (contemporary)|]]s' services including the [[Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department]], use campaign hats. Some local police use it for particular duties or divisions; for example, officers of the [[Los Angeles Police Department]]'s and [[Chicago Police Department]]'s mounted units employ the hat, and deputy sheriffs assigned as cadre of the Cook County Sheriff's Boot Camp wear campaign hats.
